review: This was the "headquarters" for the family when we visited recently for our nieces  wedding to her Nigerian fiance. The facility Is centrally located and encompasses 3 different hotels on one complex. It was safe secure and  included a buffet breakfast with a huge selection of food to choose from. It was an ideal spot and one of the best family oriented hotels in Lagos. With an outdoor pool and different Hotels and bars on the complex You did not have to leave if you didn't want to!There were readily available cabs to take to different locations that you wanted to visit. Some of the rooms could do  with some upgrading and repairs....but Overall It was great value for the cost of the rooms and I definitely recomend it!

Excellent space for office programs/retreats. Rooms were fair enough; spacious and neat. Only issue I had was that the water in the bathroom wasn't hot enough. Also, I didn't like that the bath had only half 'door/shield' because water still spilled out and the floor ended up being flooded despite the floor towel.Food was great, we had dinner at Sky Restaurant. Loved the buffet service.
It's a beautiful place with cool fresh breeze because of the trees there. The meeting rooms are amazingly conducive. Nice reception too.
A place I love to visit once in awhile because of the serenity and infrastructure put in place.The best hotel and suites in Nigeria as far as I know for now, with the advantage of the ocean view.

Beautiful, well decorated hotel in the heart of Victoria Island.  I was not staying there.  However, I came in next door to look at Nigerian Arts and Crafts.  And, we went to the hotel.  The front was exquisitely decorated with Christmas lights.  We walked through the lobby and went to the rear, which is beautiful.  There are several restaurants, a beautiful pool, a playground, and more.  The yard leading to the extensive playground is decorated with beautiful sculptures.  It is just a breathtaking place.  I don't  have enough words to describe the hotel.  I love, ‚ù§Ô∏è
The Hotel iI will want to just go to and Relax over the week end because its all chilling and good vibes coming in and out the Hotel man.. I recommend you try it.
My baby is getting old......now I need to order for tooth brush before I get.....be ready for mosquitos ü§£ their restaurant is worth checking out. I enjoyed my stay

Eko Hotels & Suites is one of the choicest hotels in Lagos State. Located in Victoria Island, the hotel has ocean view. It's serene and edifying ambience is a delight.The hotel boasts of superb rooms of different classes and uses, and excellent services.Its proximity to military bases and barracks complements it's on site security apparatus which is above average.It is a wonderful place to be.

A serene environment with large enough space , well exhibitions with a lot of other side attractions of natural essence.Expo hall was well arranged and decorated  & accommodate  large crowd  recommended for any international symposium.
Hung out by the pool side with my friends. The live band was engaging and the music was soo good. The food and service was great too. I really enjoyed the poolside ambiance and the decor
The rooms were just okay. But they had this odd smell for me. Dint like that at all.The place is big and it was the festive season so it was really crowded.
The place is well done but doesn't live up to the 7 Star standard. Be careful of the toilets some were unclean in the common areas.
Their buffet is delicious and very affordable. Food was well arranged and the waiters were too courteous
Great place to stay. Cool reception. Nice ambience and indeed relaxing after a hectic Lagos day out! You'll love the experience and will worth the effort.
I usually recommend Eko hotel for any event. The car park, space and ambience is topnotch. Though I feel the general toilet where men do number 2 can be cleaner.

Stayed at Signature. The aesthetics is great but they wanted to take an hour to make fries lol, just.Idk if it‚Äôs first day syndrome or idk the elevator wasn‚Äôt working and they don‚Äôt have stairs to goUp, just the elevator.
It was wonderful  visiting  Eko hotels  again and again.  Beautiful  and entertaining environment . Good food. Good Services.  Wonderful staffs
The hotel is very spacious but their car park is not enough for the customers, also, more security personnel are needed to direct new customers to avoid wonderers.

Wow!Eko Hotel is as beautiful and as comfortable as they get.It is a 5-star hotel and you sure get that 5-stqr treatment.Where do I begin from?The complimentary Buffet Breakfast that has an array of local and intercontinental dishes?Or the beautiful bonding moments created due to the cozy nature of the RBG Restaurant on the Ground floor of the suites?The amazing security and their attention to details?The properly air-conditioned rooms?The spacious suite?The attention to details?The accessible roads?Eko hotels ticks all the boxes for me.If you are coming to lodge here, you need to know that there are 4 'hotels' in this '1 hotel', so, you can choose appropriately.I loved the meals! I loved the ambience.The facility is Wheelchair-accessibleThere is a recycling bin on every floor too.
Fantastic experience..Buffet Breakfast is Top Notch .The DJ at the Red Restaurant  at Eko Hotels  is the best .Rooms extremely clean and well taken care off .The Landry service was  fabulous

Got the room facing the waterfront, lovely view I must say but for 100k a night the room was rather  small. They can do better with appliances though. The kettle in the room was not working and I need to boil some water for coffee. The breakfast buffet can be better. No chicken, beef, turkey or fish was in sight at breakfast. Just some fish sauce and sausages.

Eko Hotel is defined as a happening place. Hahaha. I love the environment.. most especially the ambience at night and beautiful coffee shop therein. No other way to talk about the room service but wow!!! They give you a kingly treatment.. Come with you babe, family, and friends and trust me, you will always want to return with an anticipation that always results to happiness.
Too run down, outdated,  needs major revamp of the hotel and facilities. I wouldn't book here for any function and pricy for what you get.
It was a nice, welcoming environment, with different things to enjoy.
I watched the Arise Fashion show and spent the night.The food service during the show was slow and disorganized.The room service was much better.

One of the greatest business hub in  Lagos State with numerous businesses at a goal, Eko Hotel is just like living in 9 star ‚ú® hotel. One of the biggest Hotel in Lagos and  Nigeria...It acomodates foreigners than any other Hotels in Logos, it is also location at the heart beat of Lagos close to beach...The environment is top notch and second to none. There is a big swimming pool, sports center, different continental dishes restaurant, a mini art shop at the entrance, numerous event halls and meeting halls, if there is anywhere to visit and have the vibe that you are outside the country just visiting Eko Hotel and Suites...The security is very tight and open to all 24/7...

I have been there since Saturday and everything and everyone is nice but their customer care is quite slow . It takes a lot of time for them to answer when you call them to help. The breakfast is to die for. And they take corrections without prejudice
This is a great place and the managers of this hotel seems to also have the family theme at the back of their minds. When you make a report, the management seems to respond quickly. Great place.

Prime restaurant: ambience is good, polite staff, food tasted good though the salmon appetiser was a bit too salty. Bring back the steamed hand towels please. Overall, as first timers, we were pleasantly surprised. üëç
Cool experience but I couldn't get my complementary breakfast brought to my room...
It has different halls you can use to host events. The halls have huge capacity. The environment is is beautiful one as well, and they have good security
Very nice place and silent area. I love there service
My experience there was nothing short of excellence from environment to everything, just some senior staff that sour my experience with their overzealousness, that why am giving a 4 star and not 5

One of the very good 5 Star hotel you can think of going. It's high class yes but it's worth the money. Events are going on in different areas of the building. Lots of restaurants are available around there. Enough space, serene environment. They have very good sound system available on request. I think it comes with the package of what you paid. Swimming pool too is good. If you have the money, it's worth visiting.
I went for Sunday Brunch.The service was great, Michael was our host,he was very courteous and professional.Rating the food 5/10, it was ok.
This is still one of the best place to be, car park, restaurant, event place, swimming pool and lots more.....

Other related services for banking, local transportation and access to local food stores and shops ,food vendors and FX are within range if you have a reliable guide and resources information mobile application.

It was an okay experience.Amazing view, polite attendants and a good sense of security.  I visited a few of their regular rooms which were a bit okay but the toilets in the regular rooms were quite small in my opinion.  I think they can do better with how first timers can locate their main buildings because they have quite a big compound.

Nice ambience, big and well equipped. But very overpriced for the amenities and services they provide. I have stayed here several times as it‚Äôs quite close to my meeting point. Rooms are spacious, very clean and lovely views of the pool and beach.The bathroom has everything you‚Äôd need for a short stay (aside toothpaste or brush).WiFi is a little slower than normal but still manageable. There‚Äôs no mini bar. Only a bottle of water in the room. You have to call for iron, no bathrobe nor slippers except you call.The lightings in the rooms need an upgrade to brighter lights and the lights directly over the television completely removed. Services are slow. Checked into a suite and phones weren‚Äôt working, went to reception to complain, it took over 2 hours before someone came to check and only one was fixed. Theres no internal communication amongst the staff. There‚Äôs no engineer on night duty, the safe box wouldn‚Äôt open so I had to wait for the engineer to get to work at 7:30am before I could check out to catch a flight. I hope the hotel improves. Overall, a nice hotel but over priced for the room quality and the slow service they render.

Main hotel rooms need updating, at the  minimum usb outlets to power phones. Also, the hotel should give more than 1 water bottle a day if they want to compete with the major chains. Restaurants and entertainment is great and they poolside is one of the best!
Great breakfast (buffet), prompt service response and beautiful location, however, unnecessarily expensive, rowdy reception and damp rooms/corridors.
5 star experience in a serene location. It stands out with a beautiful atlantic ocean side view
A very comfortable place üí™ Full air condition‚úçÔ∏èBeautiful RoomsüôÜüòÅ
Exit security tried charging us even though we just dropped an item off. Said 500 for parking. Dont know if that's a thing with the hotel but that's disgraceful.
A good  and nice place for you businesses exhibition, conferences and so on.
Beautiful hotel...Tasty menus and I loved the pool side. In all, a great place to be.
Nice serene environment with plenty of roomy space. Hall used for event was sound proof.
Very lovely, signature bar was top notch, have a convention hall very recommend for meeting though it‚Äôs expensive
It's comfort, luxury and peace of mind that you can't get from home, with natural food and wonderful suits.
Eko Hotel was a good experience. The services were well delivered.
It was a very fantastic time there. Love to go there over and over again
Very cool and calm environment.I love my stay with them.
Eko Hotel one of the foremost 5 star hotels in Nigeria. It's situated in the heart of the Victoria Island and the night life around it its on surplus.

Eko Hotel's memory will have a lasting impact. The service is exceptionally great. The complementary buffet breakfast for lodging is also superb. One striking thing about my stay in Eko Hotel was that pressing iron was unbelievably made available for me to iron my rumpled shirt dousing my worries of looking unkept for a meeting. For business executives, Eko Hotel is could be a life saver within minutes of a business pitch. Just dial Laundry, the guys are very helpful with their services. Nice ambience, good hotwater bath tub, tasty meals. Everything nice!!! Truly a delightful stay. There's also a non-smokers wing if you can't put up with smells from cigarettes.
Beautiful place.Loads of activities holding there and among the 5star hotel in Lagos.A safe haven
Awesome experience altogether.  Well space car park, hall setting.

I had lunch at Eko hotel and Suites and was impressed with the infrastructure. It was beautiful and quite a big place. It had four huge building with different offerings and several restaurants. The restaurant I settled for was by a big pool with an inner lounge offering buffet and an outdoor space offering a la carte.The employees are nice and helpful although the restaurant service was below what you get in any eatery in south Africa. The waiter did not seem to have an appreciation of the menu and there were no candles or any solution to deter flies from invading the food.On a brighter side the place was buzzing with people an indicator that the offerings were good.I didn‚Äôt explore any other thing except for the good lunch I had so I don‚Äôt have much improve or reduce the average score.
A hotel that give you joy and happiness, good place to go.

Right from the main entrance, this hotel is different from others. With courteous staff at each point. Large parking space makes it convenient for visitors to choose the location to drop their cars. The halls for meetings were good with A/C cooling. Water dropping from the roof was noted at a point. I hope that is fixed soon.The room was good with bed well laid and comfortable. I couldn't get fome channels to watch which I had anticipated from an international hotel as this. The bathroom can slso do with a shower door or curtain to stop water spilling beside the ceramic throne and the corridor.The buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner were all on point. I give 5 stars for that alone. Friday night buffet with live music is an excellent concept. Keep it up
Same ol, same ol.. Most crowded hotel in all of Lagos. Can be a lil nerve-racking, topped with average service.

Been to this beautiful space multiple times and the feeling was always different (positively of course).Haven‚Äôt passed the night here yet but I‚Äôve attended several events and they‚Äôve never disappointed me, not once.The organization, protocol, serenity and ambience does it for me, always.I truly appreciate the undisturbed flow of traffic (human and vehicular) in and out of this space which allows for several activities to take place concurrently without any interference of any sort. It‚Äôs very impressive.Mostly been here for conferences and the likes which includes tea breaks and lunch most times, yeah, the service was orderly and the meals were equally enjoyable.Here‚Äôs your cue to host your World Class Events, Conferences, Programs and the likes at Eko Hotels & Suites.Thank me now üòâ‚úåÔ∏è

If I should write my experience about Eko hotel I will a book, Eko hotel is the one of the best place if not the best in Lagos. The place is good, and is very nice lovely and conducive

You can always find your happy spot to chill!
One of the best and most popular hotels in Lagos. You sure can't miss it

I'm always amazed at the hotel's ability to continually recreate their environment...like the ever expanding universe. Kudos to the team.The rooms and bathrooms do need to continually be fixed up. The whole environment is so appealing with tall trees and flowers, tarred and interlocked pavements and roads. Car park is top notch. Eko Hotel and Suites really a 5 star hotel with international standards, although it's expensive as expected but it's really nice place to visit.

Awesome as usual.I must commend the security operations and how very respectful they are at Eko Hotel. I love eko .the view is madddd beautiful

Every amenity and hospitality service(s) here; inclusive of the serene ambience is 95% legit, on point, and top-notch. You will get the message right from the entrance/exit of the main gate. The coordination and helpful guidance dispensed by her security personnel and other staff give one a sense of confidence and comfort. They only need to work on the sensors that trigger the flush system on the urinary bowl for men.However, my last visit here was one of the best moments of my life.And again I still find it hard to imagine a hotel that is as old as time and still can house mind-blowing innovation and state-of-the-art amenities, cum tech support. Eko Signature is a nice comfortable hotel with impressive views of the city. I love the quietness of the rooms and hallways. The Staff are very polite. I wasn't impressed with the service generally, had to wait a long time for any service. I had to call about four times in three hours to get someone to open the fridge in my room when I checked in. Room cleaning from when it was requested to when it was done took hours. Also, the phone numbers listed for reservations are hardly answered. I had to send someone there to physically make the reservation... What I kept hearing were apologies. I can't believe how a hotel this expensive has such disappointing service. Granted its a festive season with lots of guests but still it can be better.

I loved the experience. The facilities were all intact and functioning in the room. The wardrobe space was adequate for myself and spouse. The staff at the reception were helpful and respectful.The service at breakfast which was a buffet was near excellent. The breakfast offerings were numerous and the service was fast and flowing like a well oiled factory plant. I was really impressed despite the number of people at the restaurant.I also used the Spa facility and the service was very good. The staff were professional and had a very good experience.

I really enjoyed myself lodging there. Excellent customer and room services. Dishes were of international standard. Spectacular scenes to behold from the roof top bar and pool side. The atmosphere is cool and serene with good country music to nod and dance to. A Nice place to be!!!
Good enough. Not brilliant amd services are going down steadily.

Beautiful place, same as when I first visited with my father 43 years ago as a child. It brought back so many memories. How on earth did they manage to keep up the quality?

I was confused at first but immediately u asked a security guard, he directed me to the conference hall perfectly.

Resort-style hotel(s) and building with varying levels(per price/luxury). To be sincere I have only been passing outside this place and hearing about it alone not on till now, it's really an amazing place to be although I have visited a lot of big hotels I think this is one among my top rated, very professional staff very Free and ventilated areas Fantastic eye catching environment, with much big and high important guests üòÅ they are lot to talk about but I don't think it's necessary see it for ur self just love the treatment they if you have ur money but if not ehhm I think maybe u just want to collect wototo üòÅü§£üíØ

As always, I really appreciate any public place with enough Parking lot. Because I like to be in an environment where my car is safeü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚Ä¶ That pizza by the pool side is Heavenly ü•∞. You‚Äôll love it HERE. Go on, go have fun!

Avoid the buffets at all cost.Management appeared attentive but showed apathy by ignoring his offer, didn't reply to the email for follow-up and the staff worked harder to make amends for the uneventful Mexican food offered on the $25k naira per person Buffett.* Food was luke warm to tepid at best.* No real direction nor order on where to eat or enter.* Fried food should be served hot. Fresh* Tables were not cleared and we arrived at the start of the buffet event* Chef tried when I met with him. Our server was good when we got one. He stuck it out until it was time to go home.I was okay with just making do until the locals said the native dishes were not good, either. It's a sham because I did expect more since they charge top prices, advertise expensive events and label themselves 4-5stars. I'm shocked locals entertain such given their wealth and ability. The payment system was not working and was debited on 8th of May, but  told that my card did not go through at the restaurant. It's a very nice place hotel and clean
Very good and copretive staff.

Their event facilities are great!I've never been to any Eko Hotel room but I've booked it for people and I hear the experience is great.I have, however, used their even halls on many occasions and they are great. The staff are also generally okay - organised, detailed, helpful.The halls are soundproofed. So even if they are having events in five halls at a time, you can't hear the noise from the other halls even if they are adjoining rooms. I appreciate and respect that. You can't even hear a heavy downpour if you are within the facility.Pricing for halls is also fair relative to other competitor hotels on the island.A recommendation though would be to have a safe storage for event props and ish so organisers don't have to move items especially in situations where an event runs for more than one day. They typically tell you to pack your items (excluding heavy items or fixture) and bring them the next day because they cannot guarantee the security of the items. They can do better.They also have a shuttle to take you from one building or location within the facility to another. Or say it's raining and you need a quick ride within the facility.

This is a good hotel in Lagos, Nigeria. I stayed here with a large group and they did a great job accommodating us. The food is delicious and the pool and views are amazing. The power did go out a few times during our stay. That‚Äôs really the only downside. Everything else was great:

Nice hotel within the environment. Pretty spendy. But I feel that you can enjoy the area around there if you're interested in checking out some art galleries,  or asking the front desk for a shuttle to the beach ‚õ±,  just watch out for the drivers they lurk around there.  They will overcharge you if they can.  If you're not familiar with the area, then just use bolt or uber.

Amazing.Multitudes of Hotels in Lagos aren‚Äôt worth looking at while others such as this one definitely are. The Eko Hotel boasts amazing, rooms, food, and amenities such as a pool, tennis courts, and much more. An amazing part of this hotel definitely is the view - which is amazing! If you glance outside, you will see the large beach We‚Äôve spent a couple of luxurious days at the Ego Hotel and are sure to recommend it to others. Here are some tips I‚Äôve accumulated while staying at the hotel: Tip 1: Make sure to come inside after dawn or to wear mosquito spray if you go outside after dark. It can get pretty annoying being bitten by loads of mosquitoes.Tip 2: If you are feeling kind of hot, grab your swim suite and head downstairs to the pool to cool off. It‚Äôs clean and is chemically treated; so don‚Äôt worry about any urine c;Tip 3: There are several restaurants in the hotel, some of which have a splendid view so if you‚Äôd like just ask a staff member or look at a map of the hotel to see them all.Tip 4: If you‚Äôd like to go to the beach, feel free to do so, just that it would be safer if you come in before dark because there is a small chance of you getting robbed if you are outside the facilities. Inside the facilities though, it is one of the safest places in Lagos so don‚Äôt worry.Tip 5: Enjoy your stay, stay safe and relax.Overall, you will guarantied enjoy your stay at the Ego Hotel. I hope this review helped you decide your trip.If you‚Äôd mind liking this review, the would be extremely helpful to achieving my goal of helping as many people see and decide their trips as possible because liking my review will increase the chances of others seeing them.Last note: Make sure to follow Corona regulations: Wear a mask, wash your hands and stay safe!Hope this helped,Armin

So our party of seven decided to schedule our Lunch Meeting at the outdoor Lagoon Breeze Restaurant. Excellent setting by the very alluring swimming pool, ambience was easy and calm with eager Waiters, conversations were engaging and the mood was business friendly.All was going well until Lunch was served and then the Flies swamped us. Trust me, the odd troublesome Fly in an outdoor eatery in the tropics is a given and tolerable but a swarm is certain to unsettle and ruin your meal.Food was average and could have been served at hotter temperatures. All in all, outdoor lunch dining in hot, humid conditions probably wasn't such a good idea. Maybe we should have settled for an evening timing and go away with better memories.If you must, remember to call ahead, reserve a table and place your orders to save you time and insist on portable Fly catchers.

Forgot to get the name but it was creamy as they come and with cheese just as I like it. Take a swipe at their array of ice cream and you'd get a pretty tasty desert for your troubles. But they served me small portion of lunchü§îü§î. Night view of Lagos from the room (top floors) is perfect . Eko Signature Suites.
For the kind of location, the hotel should have upgraded its amenities by now.
What a great environment, international standards compliance. Save and secure hotels. This is international standards hotel. You can enjoy your vacation in this for maximum relaxation.
A nice place to be.A comfortable and relaxing apartment.Prompt room service.Nice outdoor view.And i also loved their swimming pool

Grand facility, epitome of class and elegance!Sad thing though, I feel they are not giving back to the community as much as you would expect a multi billion dollars company like theirs should.In another thought, they are likely doing their bit by being a center of attraction that fosters tourism.I was also told that they sometimes give out free lodging to support events hosted in their premises or as give always for shows.Overall, it is a place I certainly will love to spend tangible time.

Went for 5 day business trip. Was impressed with the services. Prices for room and food slightly on higher side. But I guess its expected being far away from mainland. But overall good experience. Specially loved the Irish Bar. Please try it..also give a try to the Mexican bar and restaurant. Super.

Great ambience.Lots of activities happen at the same time in this place. From meetings (formal and informal), shows, weddings, conferences etc. Ample accommodation and secured parking. Top notch physical and technical security. Buffet is nice. Customer  service is nice with a very helpful front desk. Cash and cashless services are available.
Meals were great as usual, had a good time with my kid at the pool area. I particularly enjoyed the djs vibe, she's a breath of fresh air

I had a great time. The experience was worth it. Had a magnificent building and a courteous and friendly staff.  Have accessibility entrance. A nice place to being your kids and have a weekend getaway.It has well decorated banquet halls,  conferences halls and event centres.
I had a great time there.
One of the many beautiful places to visit in Lagos for vacation. Good jazz, good food and a few other attractions. Also popular for big events.
This is a great place for. Weekend getaway. It's also good for events, conferences, meetings and AGMs. There is so much you can do here.

The rooms are not bad, very spacious, a few defects spotted. But clean. Service by most of the staff is exceptional. The others ruin it with attitude first thing in the morning but that is dependent on the restaurant selected. WiFi need drastically improving but functional with a little bit of patience.
Eko Hotels is simply a blend of elegance, style and excellence. Visiting there would always be wonderful, particularly on weekends.

Fundamentally, not much to fault. Staff are great, for rooms - you get what you pay for. For the nitpickers like me though - Showers need work - extractor not effective enough - shower room remains a sauna even up to 30 minutes after use, unless steam allowed to enter room; floor outside shower turns to lake after shower. Door to shower/toilet showing signs of the battering taken from shower splatters.

Beautiful placeNice wardrobe and safeGreat environmentBasketball court, lawn tennis, play ground.Amazing pool. Cool elevator.Great servicesNice staffsWonderful bar areaThe restaurant is big and amazingD food is delicious and its a buffet.There is a sky lounge with great view

Sprawling landscape. Busy and yet quiet. Spacious banquet halls for events and occasions. Lovely artefacts and art and craft pieces available for purchase as decor. Very clean rest rooms. Easily accessible and very central. Great meals and pool. Recommended for a weekend getaway. Eko Hotels & Suites is a fave with Nigerian celebrities for premieres. So close to the beach, it gives an opportunity for long cool morning or evening walks. At night it promises the magic of the sights and smells of Lagos at twilight

Great thank God its Friday in the garden with good lights, life band and good crowd and conviviality. The event suit was good. The air conditioning working perfectly. The toilet were adequate in number but needs to be kept tidy

The rooms are so beautiful, the environment is lovely. Perfect for vacation, business meetings, honeymoon and weekend gateway and other things. Oh!!! You get great meals and drinks from the different restaurants.  For those that love swimming there is a great pool there and a bar by the pool. It is wheelchair friendly. Just go and look around. Go and reflect. Go and plan

Rooms are super cosy! Air conditioning and room temperature can be controlled from a central system in the room which is super! Had an outfit crisis and surprisingly the laundry had sewing kits on hand for every guest! Super impressed!The ambiance in the rooms and hallway is so tranquil and the staff are unbelievably nice and super helpful.It was a memorable experience.

5 star event center with World class acoustics event venue. The bathrooms need total refurbishment and the service is under par. Pool facilities are great with ample garden playground space and lots of parking including underground parking. Numerous restaurants available with various cuisines like Asian, Mexican and continental fine dining. Popular spot for big concerts. $$$

Lovely ambience, especially at the poolside. Ample parking space and the rooms arealright. The main hotel and kitchen staff could be a lot nicer though.There is a Saturday night Karaoke session by the poolside. The staff there are quite nice and professional.The photos are the views from a room on the 11th floor.
Just retaining its old glory. But the service is still top-notch.

Went for a dinner with a friend on 17/01/2019. The management is still doing a great job of  keeping the place in good shape. I had chicken corn soup as appetizer, then took assorted veggies salad and stewed Turkey as my main course. The atmosphere at the poolside was cool as usual. The service by the waiters was also okay. Welldone üëçüèΩüëçüèΩ

Ambience: Lively, beautiful, well lit and smells nice.Parking: Ample parking space and car movements for drop off and pick up well coordinated.Food: Tastes absolutely delicious and servers are very courteous.Wash rooms: spacious, ambience is good and well managed.They have different hall sizes for different occasions.

I was very disappointed  with how crowded the bar was, the staff did not practice social distancing, their mask was not property worn n some of the staff didn't wear their mask at all, they only had it on their chin. When prepping the cocktails, the staff used their hands to pick up ice cubes. It was disgusting to watch. Hand hygiene is key and for a supposed to be "5" star hotel, I expected good practices considering this pandemic period we re all in and the üåéeffort to reduced it's impact.

Beautiful and large  halls for your event, cute environment, reminds you of nature, clean and calm atmosphere, hospitality. Nice accommodation, workers are willing to help you, the place is just great, located on the island, V.I precisely, you can catch all the fun here, lovely arts

Eko hotels is greatly organized and spacious. The rooms are nice and neat. The car park is properly managed and the walk way is serene and nice. There have a swimming pool, a relaxation area and an arena for games and leisure activities. There is adequate security and large halls that can be used to social events

Very clean and neat environment. Always cool... You can change your foreign currencies here if you're cash strapped and in need. Antiques are also up for sale here. Although I haven't been in the rooms from what I have seen in their seminar rooms, it promises or guarantees a nice experience... I like the white painting... The trees around... This hotel is simply fantastic...
Good for event, lodging and relaxation
Decent place for all types of guests. However, exterior facilities seems outdated and poor aesthetics. Has good parking space and security
Great!!! Great view, large parking spaces, interior decor, high brow area, high security, laundry, pool side, gym, etc
Flooded bathroom once you finish bathing, aside that is a nice place and its well maintained after how many years

Eko main hotel needs some updating and work. If you're unlucky enough to be in a room that faces the road, you might be subjected to loud music from some clubs across the street.  Signature is much better. Rooms are spacious and less noise than if you were in the main hotel. But the breakfast at signature is underwhelming. Eko suites and eko gardens are decent too and quieter than the main hotel. Signature is most preferable however.

It's a nice place but I sincerely expected more. Maybe because of the hype surrounding it, I expected something more.Busy environment. Felt like the whole of Lagos was there. Local forex guys hanging around. Then too many folks hanging around taking pictures.I don't remember seeing security personnel asides those at the gate. Considering the kind of dignitaries that are supposed to be there, I expected they would be visible. Probably they were there but just in the background ready to act if needed.Their halls are quite nice. At least, the two I've been in.I'm yet to lodge there. Hopefully, when I do, I'll have a better experience to report. For now, it's not exactly a place I would "fight" to go.
Exclusive and Number one when it comes to hoteling... üîë
A serene environment with lovely sea view. However, customer relations service needs to be worked on. I've had to cancel twice on room service because their response was slow.

Great service here on the Signature side.  The fellows at the bar make great drinks. Try the Mojito.  The hotel is at a great location and the lounges,  pools side and restaurants are great. The signature rooms are ok but a little over rated and need some updating. But its a great place that I always enjoy visiting.
Sunday Lunch & BBQ is the best in Lagos, not to be missed! And of course, the pool ambiance is great üëåüèªüëåüèª

Beautiful. Chic. Multi functional place for a getaway, business meeting, wedding, conference, sports to say the least. Food is tasty. Concierge service is good. The swimming pool is large and well maintained.Laundry service is very terrible. I personally resolved not to use the service. Takes over 24hours and several reminder calls to get clothes back.Not an ideal place for a quiet getaway because of its busy ambience.
Nice scenery. Class and good taste in finishings

Cool, calm atmosphere. Friendly respectful staff. Great facilities in a secure and beautiful location. A great place to stay, if you're visiting Nigeria. Also great for business meetings, conferences and events.
Wow! The Ambience, food, reception was epic. My team and i were treated to a Sunday afternoon buffet

Accomodation is decent though you would expect alot more from a place with that name. They should remodel as various parts of the accomodation seem to be coming off at the seams(weird stale odour along the corridors, painting peeling off the walls, bathroom shower heads all rusty, AC systems are so noisy and do not really cool. The food leaves less to be desired of.

Eko Hotels & Suites is old, yet phenomenal!  It seats on a beautifully crafted and well thought-out landscape of Victoria Island in Lagos. My favourite seat out has to be the bar by the beautiful pool area. The architecture, the seat arrangement, the sky blue, crystal clear swimming pool, the wooden furniture and tents, the tents and all combine to create an absolutely fantastic spectacle. The hotel is usually very busy as a result of the numerous scheduled social events they host on a regular basis. It prides itself with some of the most busy and prestigious halls and events spaces in the VI metropolis. The parking space is merely satisfactory as it usually does not cater for the horde of guests to whom the hotel has become a psychological need. You'll find a craft shop by the parking lot area, an art Gallery within the main building and a host of restaurants and lounges as well.I'm a fan! ü§£ü§£ü§£
Good space and great provision for parkingFantastic security team, always willing to help.
1. Awesomely beautiful2. Serene ambience3. Good food4. Extreme Hospitality5. Buh d traffic jam needs to be worked on especially when going out

The pool doesn't have stale water like most pools do, it is continually refreshed. So if you're scared about pool hygiene.  You can trust them. I did not stay in the rooms...but they do have good rest areas. Very soothing might i add...and lest i forget, you can get privacy if you're alone or with a partner at the poolside. Sweet!

Worth the money, they have over the years tried to maintain the standard that has been set.. A very good location for hosting events of all kinds. Amenities abound such as the swimming pool, gym, spa, nail studio and of course wifi for guests. In all its a place that one should spend a night if the means is available. Also they know how to decorate their space for Christmas.

There was adequate parking but there was no signage to indicate the direction of the exit gate so we went round till we found it ourselves. The event hall was beautiful and had enough facilities like entrances and restrooms. Acoustics and lighting too was well done
I enjoyed my stay here, I met a lot of superstars ranging from ruger to joeboy, portable the zazoo crooner, Zlatan, ill bliss, kogbagidi, and many more
A very busy hotel. And despite the number of people they have to cater for they still manage to treat everybody as a special guest. Great ambience and courteous staff. Will definitely come again

The spa is the worst ever, they had to give out my space because I went to get water for 3 minutes even when I told the person in charge and i had to wait for another 2 hours. My family had to wait for me to finish up since they were down with their own massage. Very poor service. I‚Äôll never visit there again!

Great location. Lots of amenities plus a play area for kids at the back of the hotel. Nice choice of food at the buffet. Friendly staff. Wifi is quite poor though, good for basic browsing but not for opening files saved in work drives.
Beautiful nice though a bit rowdy with cars and difficult getting a nearby parking lot...quite conducive and hommy place to be...
One of the best, if not the best 5-star hotels in Nigeria. Great customer relations, serene atmosphere with a heavy security presence. Large parking space etc
Serene environment nearer to Lagoon
It's a beautiful place to be no doubts

Terrible! Hotel surroundings are nice but the rooms are run down and not well maintained. My ceiling was leaking in the bathroom and the air con kept leaking water. We got trapped in the bathroom as the door broke.

We were not guests at the hotel but we usually come chill at the pool side on a Sunday. It's a lovely place. Food is really not too bad. Pool side is amazing and so are the prices. I enjoyed my every visit.
Beautiful to behold, quite an elaborate landscape

Eko Signature is probably one of the most beautiful suites I have stayed in. Beautiful, spacious and cosy. I especially loved being able to order room service from the TV screen.Update: I stayed in the main Building this time. It's nothing like Signature. The AC is really noisy, the bathroom looks really old, I had issues with the door on my third day there, apparently the battery died and it took more than 20min to diagnose and fix.The head room in the bathroom is only 2m. Makes it look cramped.The only plus was that I had a really good view of the Atlantic. It's was a spectacular view to wake up to every morning.Update: I stayed in the suites this time. It's much better than the main building, but not as great as Signature. It's also as serene and quiet as signature.The rooms are also bigger than for Main hotel.
Very beautiful place to relax after Monday to Friday work. Just go there and enjoy your weekend.
Spent 12 days here and my stay was very comfy, and subtle. Guest service line was always busy tho, but asides that was all in all a pleasurable place to stay.

I attended a conference here. Wasn't opportuned  to visit rooms or probably lodge but I love the link from the entrance through the hallway connecting the conference rooms. It was easy and made it reasonable enough for hoteliers not to be disturbed. The halls are well big and well spaced. Lovely interior. Ample parking state and we'll coordinated arrangement.

The best hotel in lagos for expats...very much choice for different food. And good service everywhere around the hotel. You also have the irish pub near by so for everyone you have something. The pizza üçï  at the poolbar are very very good! And the gym is big and plenty machines for everyone. Really coming back here whenever I am in lagos again...
The Eko Signature was amazing as an establishment and the service was even much better. As a matter of fact, I even got laundry service around 3AM which blew my mind.
Lovely place to be if you're visiting Lagos or want a mini getaway from Lagos hussle x noiseüòÖ
Excellent place, lovely.
The only infrastructure I have seen federal government manage very well, maybe because they make alot of money that goes back into the hotel.

Humidity and flies is maybe the only reason that I don't give it 5 stars. Service was fantastic and friendly!! The local beer went down well and the pizza was scrumptious at the pool bar and Restuarant. This is my first time here and I think if I return a couple of times while I'm here I might just upgrade my rating. I went back again to experience some of the most breathtakingly views from the rooftop bar. This is really a very visitor friendly hotel. Oh this time I did not experience any flies ü§ó

It was a wow experience. A great place to stay, relax and enjoy the numerous facilities available. Eco signature was a home away from home. The complimentary buffet was out of this world. The roof top bar was a great experience, overseeing the beauty of Vi toria Island. The pool side bar seating close to the beach was an amazing sight to behold. I wouldn't forget the well trained staff that made the short stay worth the while
I‚Äôll give this place a 10!
Best place to have a nice time

The staff especially at the pool side will just leave you unattended. I sat there and watched a full 90mins match unattended. I called, they just walk past. I went to complain.., they just told me that they are coming and didn't evn care to ask where i was sitting. Meaning that they will not come. Its really pathetic. The ambiance is cool though. Great parking lots. Clean environment.

Its a nice and popular place...tho' I forgot my pretty "Ego heeled slippers" called back in less than an hour and it couldn't be found. Twas my sister's birthday so she came back we stayed for 4days before she left. They've got great customer service, they offer assistance just in case you forgot your stuffs (as seen in the picture) and they offer incentives too such as free massage days, hair blow dry, pedicure etc... It's a very nice place not just that its also interesting!üòä @regalmonalisa_mü¶Ñüíé

The room was amazing, the bed very comfortable. Breakfast was ok...I did not go to the Main Dining room, it was too crowded. The gym is huge with all kinds of state of the art equipment. The instructor was totally indifferent the second time I went. I went to get my nails done at the Spa and got the fastest, and poorest manicure in my life!!! She did not wash, do cuticles, massage, nothing. It was more like a simple paint...and I was charged $20 or thereabouts...the massage was good. It was supposed to be Swedish but was actually more Thai...but it was a good massage. However, no shower...
It was such a serene environment and it felt so good to be at a popular five star hotel. Although, my aim of visit was business, I do hope to get back there for pleasure.
The hotel rooms are state of the art but the service was horrible. It is as if they intentionally put off the air conditioning.
It's simply the best although food services are a bit slow however you can't but give it them
I had dinner at the Sky restaurant. Every bite was a promise kept. Well worth my time.The rooms are great too. Sunday Brunch is amazing.
Nice place. Well organized for events too. The bar ... absolutely relaxing

It's a very good hotel in a busy environment of Victoria Island, Lagos. I think Eko Hotels and suites is one of the best hotels on the Island, if not the best. The new facility called Signature is superb and it's a great place to be. I will rate it 7 stars if there's anything like that üòÅ

It's central, it's busy, it's alive, a microcosm of Lagos energy. This is the perfect place to experience it! The ambience is great for business and networking. Second to none when it comes to meetings and conferences.Leisure is not left out. All in one place, you can enjoy the pool side bar (Calabar bar?), live band (I think it's Friday nights) and some of the finest Restaurants in Victoria Island (Crossroads, Sky, 1845, Lagoon Breeze,  Red, Irish Pub, etc.) Forgive me if I don't remember it all - the pandemic didn't help anyone's social life.It's four hotels  in one, you'll definitely find something that works for you. They've done some renovation and upgrades too, thank God! If you're a finicky traveller,  you'll still have a bit to complain about but there are so many trade-offs... Relax! Enjoy your stay!

Amazing world class service.  I spent a week and half and I excellent room service.  Their breakfast buffet is to die for.   You get a wide range of continental and African cuisine.  You can chill at the lounge in the evenings and also there is a rooftop bar.  It is centrally located and also has an world standard gym.
The environment is very beautiful, with good parking space.The service is also nice...

International standard, world class hotel with serene, beautiful and well landscaped environment with ample well designed parking space in a conducive and very welcoming environment. It is located in the heart of the beautiful Victory Island, Lagos. It has rooms, halls, conference centres and lodges of multiple sizes, rates, comfort but all of world standard. It is a known hotel in Lagos, Nigeria, Africa and beyond with an uncompromising standard and taste. It overlooks the Atlantic Ocean and gives all visitors a good holiday, party or relaxation experience. It is an awesome environment
Comfortable bed,room, bathroom and mad view.If u can afford it,go for it .. standard.Their buffet is so lovely,food tastes home made.Loved my stay
An excellent and exquisite accommodation.

When you want to talk about class, if you are not saying Eko hotel then you are not talking.I love everything about this place, from the reception, to the rooms, to the restaurant, the poolIf you are lodging here please ask for the pool view, where you can a view of the pool and the oceanBest time to sink everything in is....in the evenings, when all the lights are on and you can chill by the pool side and have fun.Subscribe to my YouTube@gaffilicious gaffy for more info

Very massive property running 300++ rooms. Though there's old and new buildings and has lots of differences but still they are big and spacious.the swimming pool area is so cool. I love the trees around, outdoor dining is really nice. They have friday buffet which is really good.

Lovely, i enjoyed my stay, it was fun all the way for me, the reception i received at arrive was inviting and left me wanting more of it. Because i love cute things and style, and my special interest in bedding, beautiful bedding that bring that pop in a roomSo staying on the bed was cool it gave me gentle reminder of home.The foodüòåüòå, sweet.Eko hotel is a place to be

Spacious parking spaceLocated on the heart of the islandVery good security control at the entrance and in the elevatorsOne of the feature I like most is the inability to access floors that you don't have business with using the elevators. This ensures privacy and good access controlsFood is nice and has variety of optionsThere is also a bar for chilling out. Plenty of conference rooms, gym, pool, free WiFi etc. The rooms are pretty tidy
Eko is Simply amazing Classy, I love the Food the view, hall, and the atmosphere.... Best choice for your business meetings, lodging or conferences.
Even by the looks of the hotel you know it's gonna be good, the best for comfort, relaxation, nice environment, greatest view
Nice. Service is amazing

Such a beautiful hotel. I must applaud the facility management team, they are doing an amazing job managing such a hug facility and keeping it clean and comfortable. The halls are amazing and would be great for ceremonies like birthdays, conferences and weddings.
First time in Lagos, first time at Eko Hotel.The pillows were fluffy, the food was great the view from the pool side was calm and the lighting was perfect.

Lodged here recently. Rooms are ok. Internet is ok. Courteous staff. The showers need work though, and there needs to be an expeller installed in the bathrooms.A nice place to chill, provided you have the funds for it.
I only visited the patio, pool,  and bar area. Very nice place.

Eko hotel is a place where travelers use to lodge especially those people going or traveling abroad. It is a big place, they have big car park, multipurpose hall, swimming pool nice and delicious food and lots more.

An easy to locate Hotel and Suite, spacious conference halls. The rooms are neat, the environment is safe and neat also. And anyone visiting for the first time will enjoy their stay and note the food there isn't cheap so make sure you have enough cash when visiting.

This is a very nice and classy place to enjoy your stay in Lagos. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Prices are relatively very respectable for this type of hotels, maybe the best hotel in Lagos. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone that is thinking of visiting Lagos. Also the security is very strict, you'll feel very safe in their environment, which is a big bonus.
Wow I loved it so so muchThe services are just so awesomeüíØüòöüëåand the sea  view from my room is just so beautiful
This is the 7th time am booking for George's residence and it's exceptional , customer services are top notch. Once again JAMESOFLAGOS is impressed.

It is a decent hotel in a decent environment with courteous staff. The WiFi is however nothing to write home about - especially with 5MB per day.  You also have to sign in as you move from one building to another. There is ample parking and it is free for guests. The gym is well equipped (for both cardio and strength training)

Cool, secured nice buildings, new large expanse of space for more cars to  park, well marked out, in addition to the underground carparks. Good place to be. Oh! Did I tell you about the new Irish Pub; the exact replica of the Pub anywhere in the world, this is just one of the addition to other cozy restaurants here already. You can try it out.
Very beautiful stage for performance

Beautiful and massive structures, its an all in one hotel, quite a number of restaurants in the large expanse of land, conference rooms and event halls, it's complete with a club.Security is tight enough, beautiful pool, all-you-can-eat buffet and finger licking food from the main hotel restaurant. Beautiful view of the poolside and the Ocean.The only issue: They need to renovate or carry out maintenance in the old rooms/buildings, there's this dry musty smell from the air conditioning vents. Some of the furniture is old too.
Love the Ambience and the details of the spaceI particularly loved that there was a space to read and do work related stuff .

Eko hotel is one of the biggest and prestigious hotels in Lagos State, Nigeria. Aside covering a vast expanse of land, it borders the Atlantic ocean and the new Eko Atlantic, thus has a great view of the island.Eko hotel has several entry points to places of interest within, however, only one entry and exit gates to/from hotel.The hotel has some suites detached from the main hotel and can be said to be exclusive to requesting clients only. Thus keeps the guests away from the traffic at the main building.Eko hotel has several meeting rooms and a grand hall for large activities. Service is on point and trap breaks are well coordinated by the banqueting team. The restaurant is well situated and food is good. It also has a great view of the bar and pool.Car park is humongous, there is a multilevel car park attached to the hotel, entry into the hotel is by the meeting halls, which helps to restrict quests to functions from walking through the hotel if not necessary.Aside, it also has car parks around the grounds of the hotel for convenience.Since it's renovations, there have been great accolades for the hotel.Eko hotel comes highly recommended.

Most sought after hotel üè® in Lagos Nigeria üá≥üá¨! The largest and most popular! Their service is next to know ! Lovely hotel room and big parking space ! They have restaurants and club in the compound! Also a very large swimming pool! Atm machines , outdoor bar and many many more ! A place to be and a place to visit

The first time I was at Eko Hotels and Suites I feel like I am in South Africa. Their facilities include.1. Well equipped SPA and Gym centre where you ll meet a young man called Coach. He is a very good instructor, humble and polite.2. Crossroad Bar with premium whisky, cocktail, beers, wine and more.3. Standard swimming pool4. Underground car park5. Water view and more.6. ATMs and moreThe building is well maintained and secure.

Honestly? Eko hotels' Sports Cafe isn't the place any more.Unless you are staying in the hotel, please DO NOT spend your precious 13k for lunch there on their buffet.Limited range of meals, desserts used to be at least 8 variants excluding icecream. Now, diced watermelon was in both ice-cream tubs, no other fruit was present and 3 variations of desserts.Don't get me started on the drinks!
Very warm and friendly place to spent time with family and friends. Suitable for all occasions

Considering the surrounding area, this hotel is an oasis. But comparing it to hotels in other countries, it needs a lot of work. The staff was very friendly and eager to help. There were many restaurants but they were terribly overpriced. The rooms were clean but the bathroom was kind of moldy and not very well designed. The shower was like standing in a metal shack. The wifi was adequate at best but in some areas, including my own room, I could not get signal. If the management invested in some quality routers then this would not be a problem.  Also at all times this hotel was crowded because there was always a convention or something taking place.

Very poor air conditioning in both the main building and Eko suites. I can barely sleep when I'm here. It's difficult to see beyond that. Though the pool and grill is quite nice. I'll give customer service 55% score. It's a really busy place.

Except for a cool ambience, their buffet was rubbish. I won't recommend their sky restaurant for anyone. Common water, you have to wait to be served even when you're eating. I suppose when you're choking you still need to indicate to someone you need water?
Eko hotels is a wonderful place to be the rooms are awesome and neatly kept, the environment is clean and there security men are kind.

This is a fantastic hotel with all the amenities you can think of. They considered nearly everything in its construction.It has lovely views, competent staff, swimming pools 4 elevators which need access card to operate, functional kitchens which sometimes serve very limited options, insufficient parking space and many other amenities.The Ego dogmatism also a nice one and is better than the Main hotel. However,  I thing the hype on this hotel is a little too much.You can easily meet celebrities and very influential people here.
I had a meeting in one of the halls of the hotel  I cannot rate the rooms. I wxpected the restrooms to be more classy considering the popularity of the hotel

The rooms here are absolutely beautiful and expensive. A really nice and neat place to be.Great service and food, on the high side though. I love the atmosphere in the evenings.I highly recommend this hotel away from the craziness and traffic in Lagos.It's heaven on earth, far from any hazzles, but be ready to spend.Great for couples and for people in the  business world. Trust me, It's a beautiful hide out.

I had one of my best experience stay there a few days, Environment is so cool, Room service I awesome and the Room is standard for a Top class Hotel.I must say you won't regret coming.Just don't forget your Key card or leave anything behind.

This used to be one of the best hotels way back but now, it is riding on it's past glory.The ambiance is still really nice and welcoming but the rooms are nothing to "write home about" and the service (especially room service) is, on a scale of 1 - 10, is 3.

The hotel is a very lovely place, the environment was very neat and calm. There was power and water supply throughout my stay, the hot water shower was running also, but there were mosquitoes in my room. But, I loved every minute I spent at the hotel.

With their high level of organisation & coordination, it only shows they are detailed & have tested & working systems with structures in place to meet up with any short comings, security is top notch also with their have well-trained staffs. This is a nice place to be with family.

Best hotel for corporate functions in Lagos but not ideal for a romantic getaway. Spacious and services are decent. The 5 star event center always sports a concert or 2 and a great Wednesday night out at the Crossroads bar

A perfect place for relaxation, lodging and events. The relaxation spot by the pool is non like I've seen, with the fresh island air slowly caressing your skin as you eat amd drink. The hotel rooms and services is excellent, exquisite and fit for men of honour. The large event halls is also a first choice for weddings, concerts, meetings and general gatherings!

Service was really great. The staff are professional, courteous, friendly and ready to help. The room (Eko Suites) is spacious and offers a view of the city. It also has kitchen area, enough space to store your belongings, coffee table, comfortable sofa, refridgerator, TV as well as a safe. Breakfast is free, free WiFi and shuttle buses available to move within the hotel premises and sometimes even outside the premises. The food portion is a whole lot! Rooms are air conditioned, water heating system and hair dryer works well. Room service comes late when they have several orders. The hotel has several amenities like swimming pool, gym, spa, about 5 different restaurants, an Irish Pub and other bars. Parking space available for checked in guests of the hotel.
A very beautiful place üòäüòäüòäüòä standard and classic. If you are not a crowd person or you don't do well around people then this place isn't for you. Eko hotel is a great place to be.
Beautiful place for Hangout, especially the poolside. Waiters are attentive, ordered some beers and fries.
It is a comfortable place for lodging, event and meetings. The rooms a ensuite and the Security here is good

Ideal location for families. The tropical Christmas activities were very family friendly. Meal time was filled with lovely options, cleanliness was spot on, friendly and helpful staff. Only con is the worn out bed sheets in use, some were frayed, but always clean.

Segregated service and pricing. Big hotel with largest function rooms in the city. Very poor services in the restaurant by the pool. There you'll find staff that look flustered and overwhelmed or cranky. A few pleasant ones though. You could finish your breakfast before the spoon or tea you requested is delivered to you.  At some point I left my meal to go ask for a powdered milk. I ordered dinner at 9:20pm and it was delivered 11:05 pm as I was pulling up the sheets. Run from room service or starve.

This was my First Visit To this Property. the house keeping and restaurant staff very helpful and try their best to keep you satisfied.The staff at the reception desk get a bit restless when the deposit you put down at the time of checking inn kind of runs low and pester you over the phone or when ever they see you to top up, but i was made to understand that's the way over there.Now if you have been hear you will not understand what the fuss was all about ,for crying out loud there is a hydraulic ramp and barrier at the gate and armed guards at every turn if the guards won't get you the thugs just outside the gate will.They must learn to be flexible with foreigners, we had spent so much money at that location as we had booked a conference room and 3 single rooms and had meetings for 2 days and the company that i worked with is a well recognized one and my colleagues have been in and out of this place for the past 5  years. it must have been very embarrassing for them when the reception staff treated me like a pickpocket on the first two days.But on our 3rd day everything changed for the better wonder why........

In Lagos for a visit and looking for a nice classy hotel to stay? Say more. Eko hotel is one for that. From their effective services , to homely environment, tight security and more!. My favorite place is the hotel is the pool side. So relaxing. You wouldn't regret making a stop!

The location of hotel was good and close to everywhere. Rooms are clean, comfortable and roomy. I guess they have at least 10 restaurants from different kitchens inside the hotel. Breakfast is nice and various. The live music in the garden is excellent.You can find a tennis court and a basketball area. Wi-fi passwords are provided 24 hours, it's not nice. You have to ask for a password at the reception.

Great place and lovely ambience. There are plenty spots to hangout with friends. Most events in Lagos take place but don't drive there when there's any event cos you won't have anywhere to park. They have parking space issue which needs to be addressed.

I didn't stay here but I considered a night there. It was too rowdy for my liking. I tried having lunch there also, I just wasn't feeling it therefore I went back to Southern Sun Hotel Ikoyi. I'm sure many others would love Eko Hotels. I am just not into rowdyness and highlife.
Quite place close to Sea beach in Victoria Island.

This is review is for the room service of Eko suites.The meal was pounded yam with vegetable soup. Took long for it to be served (about an hour). The soup was just okay. Didn‚Äôt have any ‚Äúwow factor‚Äù in my opinion....Same as above with the chips and fish that was served.The suite was good though. Had a modern aesthetic feel to it.
An absolutely exquisite place to stay

Beautiful hotel with so many amenities. 10 restaurants and 3 bars. Pool, spa, salon, nail bar. The pool is gorgeous. The room was clean and comfortable. Staff is very attentive and accommodating. The hotel is very expensive though as most hotels are, 1.5l bottle of water was #1,400 and continental breakfast was #7000. It‚Äôs better to go out and eat because there are so many options around the location.

General: Easily one of the premier hotels in Lagos and very much at the centre of things. Most importantly, they have been able to maintain their image, service offering and quality for so many years.Good: Wonderful location at VI. Very large with hundreds of rooms. Service is nice and extremely varied. Customer sercice is very good. The rooms are large and the beds soft.  Amenities ALWAYS work, a major point in a place like Nigeria. The outdoors - pool, gym and other sports area - are large, well built and maintained. Quite a number of restaurants so variety would never be a problem. Large event centres, such that there's always an event going on in the grounds. A very classy bar/lounge on the ground floor for catching a drink and having a great night.Bad: Prices are not for the fainthearted. But of course, this is not a surprise based on what they have to offer.
One of the best hotels in Lagos. Great buffet here

I was here one time for an event and with what I saw I think its conducive to whatever kind of event you might be planning to host, they have just about everything to fit any event or program, the very large hall that was used was fully air conditioned, security was tight and everything was in good order.Their restaurant also was top notch, with nice array of menus which are relatively affordable.
Very well known, secure and 4 to 5 star hotel in Lagos. Quite pricey and huge variety of rooms. A lot of other events happen here too with their popular event venue and assorted bar and restaurant.
I came around for a conference organized for women in oil and gas industry. The ambience was cool and warm. However, The toilets need some refurbishment. Also, the food served could have been better.

Definitely one of My Favorite Lodging Spots. Mainly for the View and The Poolside Bar. Rooms are decent and service varies but... I'll still stay there almost always because I love that waterside view.

It was my first experience in this 5 star world class hotel. Their level of  hospitality is a top notch. I thought it was all about hotel lodging and all, but I was mistaken, their event halls are all exquisite, elegantly styled to suite all forms of events. All facilities are world class ranging from pools, gym house to bars restaurants and lounges. It's more than a mansion, it's much more than a hotel. No wonder it's being called "HOTEL and SUITS"

Super lovely, I like this place in particular, the service is also dope, strict and focused, nice place for business and pleasure, great sightseeing and relaxation,it also a perfect weekend getaways for those who wants to, yes I live the size of the swimming pool,  I love the way the bars and designed, I love the privacy of the bar in particular, it top notch. It a great view with good hall spaces,  I strongly recommend this place

Very popular as a venue for corporate and social functions hence easy to find. Got a number of bars and restaurants. Preferred the outdoor pool bar though service was a little rigid not allowing you adapt your order to suit the customer's unique need- which was a lil disappointing. Ambience was okay and a vibrant atmosphere. Ordered the Fish (served with fries) off the menu, didnt taste particularly fresh however my friend had the buffet option and had a different experience (fresher food).A good spot to meet-up with friends, colleagues, family or even try solo.
Easy to locate, a good place to relax and enjoy.

The staff is on point, very welcoming. The security detail was good too. I love the room, pool and the ocean view. I'd love to visit with my wife the next time. Definitely one of the best hotels in lagos given that l have visited many.
An awesome hotel with adequate parking, luxurious rooms and tasty meals as well as professional staffs.

The rooms are nice and the air conditioner works pretty well too. The reception area for Eko gardens could be improved by adding an additional staff to reduce the pressure on the only person on duty (particularly during this festive season), plus the need for  more fans or just completely enclose the reception.

Below is my picture standing on the grand floor of this magnificent five star hotel. It's a beauty to behold plus their unparalleled customer service. Neat environment, good meal both national and continental dishes. It is simply a place to be.
conducive environment.there eatery is too notch and there swimming pool üòòbut contact the admin if you want to do a professional Photoshop so you won't be embarrassed..
Super nice location and a dental clinic is close to the place , which is called first mobile dental care, lagos Island

Had a cocktail and a meal at the Sky Restaurant on the top floor of the main hotel building.Excellent cuisine, polite, friendly and professional staff, fantastic views, especially at sunset. Best place in Lagos from which to get a panoramic view of the Eko Atlantic projectOverall, always a great experience ‚Äúin the sky‚Äù
Great place to stay. You pretty much have everything around you. Kind of pricey though, but you'll get value for your money.

Cool hotel generally. Buffet had impressive variety. Comfortable halls for various events. Good and spacious parking. Good atmosphere with breeze from the ocean to make it a place to relax. Hopefully the rooms and other services would be as good too
It gets improves day by day. For your exquisite events and Balls, it's a best bet!

Eko hotel had in the past lived up to its name and reputation. But that can't be said the place in recent times. The outward look is still one of best in the country, getting inside isn't quite same, though renovations are going at the time of this post. So I guess it will look better than it used to be. But the services were never compromised, they still offer the same professional and eloquent services to customers. There swimming pool isn't just lovely, it looks it too. The buffet could have been better especially when compared to other hotels in similar category.
Eko Hotels and Suites is perfectly okay for any form of hospitality ranging from lodging to events. Superb

Their buffet is wonderful with many options to choose from. The staff are also warm, friendly and professional. Quite affordable and also a family fun place for the entire family. I reccomend @Eko Hotels & Suites for anyone visiting Lagos Nigeria .
If you're not lodging, parking fee will be attached after 10 minutes, but it's a wound full place to be

I liked many things about this hotel, big  busy but thoroughly coordinated (or so I thought) and then I got this note the night before I left... see attached photo.  A notice asking me to quit my room before 9am because of a "fumigation exercise". Really who treats guests like that? Oh usual check out time is 12!

The service was horrible. Staff were focus on payment rather than  rendering service. Everything is overpriced and poorly delivered. The foreigner were treated with more preference than locals. Poolside toilets are dirty and unkempt. I was truly disappointed by the service I recently received.
Eko Hotel lays out a good spread of F&B. I highly recommend their poolside Club Sandwich and the Crossroads Bar Iced Lemon MargaritaüòÅ
The best events venue in Lagos

I must first say that I was there only for dinner at the sports cafe. The reception at the entrance was warm, sitting arrangement was well done. The food was laid out buffet style  with nigerian dishes, continental dishes, salads and pastries were in different sections. The variety of food that was available made my day. Then there was show cooking, the chef for that evening was a very young man named Victor and his cooking was both beautiful and tasty. I was spoilt for choice. I could say the dinner was pricey but I got real value for my money. Did I just hear you ask if I will go back there? That's right, I plan to return several times. The dinner was memorableüòâ

I had more xpectation than what I experienced. The rug looks dusty and dirty. I expected a better atmosphere from an international hotel (5star hotel). Their small chops was good, sound system too was ok, but they can improve.

Expensive all around for what you get, but what you get can't be got in lots of Lagos.  New Irish pub is beautiful.  Food is just ok.  Hit and miss. Fish and chips terribly small.  Chips pretty bad. Lamb stew was so so.  Burgers are good. Service can be slow when it gets busy.

I don't know how stars this hotel has. It stands tall and proud with expansion work going on. Basically the hotel chain has taken over the whole street and behind. The dinner buffet was a pleasant surprise. They had ice cream on the desert table with all sorts of fixings. The grounds are still well kept for such a vast land area. Same as the rooms. My only issue is when the have shows are products launch,  then some street urchins gain entry and the event/place is no longer as classy as it should.

Exciting and interesting experience in one of Nigeria's recognisable five Star hotels. It's always a great experience relishing Eko mouth-watering meals. The room, particularly the massive bed, is also another cherished experience.
Okay experience. Would have given it a 5 but they had a rude staff at the restaurant.Nice place overall.

We had to ask for towels and toilet paper every day . Staff tried, but they are overworked and underpaid . It was vary rare to see staff smile, they all looked very sad . Perhaps the greedy owner should train staff well, and pay them accordingly.  Forget ordering food from the international menu . It does not exist .When you order food from room service , it takes so long . They say 20 minutes , but in actual fact it takes 1 hour . I truly understand the meaning of African time.  The positive side of the hotel is the cleanliness.  Cleaner do their job well . PAY YOUR STAFF WELL AND YOU WILL ACHIEVE BETTER STAFF MORALE .

The perfect place with the right balance in culture, modern facilities and hospitality.With a beautiful selection of restaurant types from Italian to Chinese, good size pool, though with a ridiculous buffet purchase requirement for non-residents.I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a good time done in style with a tinge of class.

Eko hotel is one of the best hotels and suites in Nigeria... Good parking space, nice event center, elevator from the down floor to any floor you want to get to.,club house available, Games house available, spa is also available, 24/7 electricity, tight security,customer service is on point, room service is super awesome, nice convention centers,nice relaxation centers, bars, alot of conveniences

I love the ambience of the place. Built for large conferences... Has up to 900 rooms. The food is exquisite... Love the food basket at The Irish pub, the homemade mayonnaise, Salitos brew : it brings me back all the time. It's also a venue for dollars change. I have a reliable contact there. All in all, the standard of Eko Hotels and Suites is noteworthy.
Beautiful place with 1at class conference e centres and rooms. One thing I love about them is constant upgrades going on the premises

Very good location, good name but losing out in promptness. My room was not cleaned until 8pm after several calls. Loosing standard as well keep asking for shower gels, complimentary water etc. The sewage smell feels the room through the bathtub drain.

I attended a conference at the convention centre of Eko hotel and suites. The hall was okay with a good sound system and cooling system. The projector worked fine and the stage was had enough room for pacing.The food was just ok. Nothing out of the ordinary. It wasn't the best I've tasted anyway.Downside:The toilet is a really big disappointment. The wash hand basins where really old and filthy. Most of them were out of use.The toilet were out of hand towels before noon and there were not replaced. I find it rather strange
The Saturday and Sunday buffet was fantastic. My family and I, with friends throughly enjoyed the place

Believe it when I tell you this is the best home away from home in the whole of West Africa. It's a city on its own. When you're in this premises anything is possible and whatever you want you will get.

Established in 1977 as √àk√≥ Holiday Inn and built on Victoria Island, it is the largest hotel in Nigeria. It was designed by architect Oluwole Olumuyiwa in collaboration with Americans. It was subsequently renamed Le Meridien Eko Hotel and Suites, Lagos. L'Hotel Eko Le Meridien is part of the Chagoury Group of companies.The Hotel building comprises 825 rooms and suites in four multistory buildings, clad in white with views of the Atlantic Ocean and the Kuramo Lagoon. The hotel located next to the financial centres of Lagos Island: Victoria Island.Eko Hotels & Suites has a sister hotel in Port Harcourt named Hotel Presidential.Eko Hotels & Suites has the largest Convention Centre in Nigeria. Events that have taken place at the hotel include; concerts, movie premieres, international exhibitions, weddings, conferences  and Award ceremonies. The Convention center is usually used for these events and can cater to 6,000 people.There are eight restaurants and bars within the hotel complex:The Sky Restaurant & Terrace located on the Roof of the Hotel.Crossroads Tex Mex Restaurant and Bar which serves Mexican Cuisine.1415 Italian Restaurant, located at Eko Signature which specializes in Italian Fine Dining.Kuramo Sports Caf√© serves continental and local dishes with a full buffet.Red Chinese Restaurant which is located at the roof behind the Eko Convention Centre.The Lagoon Breeze Restaurant which is also known for its BBQ Fridays.The Grill "Steakhouse" located at EKo SuitesCalabash Bar, an open-air bar by Kuramo Sports Cafe offers special cocktails and other beverages
Nice place to lounge. Security is top notch
I Love Going to Eko Hotal & Suites well Organized but Staff there are Very Rude

Had a good comedy show here. Well arranged setting @Convention center. Eko Hotel is what it is and on this day the parking lot was stretched. Once the show started, there was traffic to connect to and from Signature and this did not abate till around midnight. Also to note were cars parked around the drop off point further fueling traffic in this area.Noticed a floor for cinema and looking forward to visit here soon.For the show @ Convention centre, the lighting could be have been better while the surround sound was clear enough with good reverbation.

Loved it. The crossroad bar is top notch and offers the sports lover a perfect place be.
