You will quickly forget the missed chances of your favourite team as you bask in the euphoria of excitement when they finally score. Staff are professional and courteous.If your craving is for Mexican food or 800g beef ribs.  Then yep this is your spot. Be it business or holidaying,  Eko Hotels offers a perfect mix of hospitality and social nightlife on the same site. :)

The reception is always been upgraded in a way to make it attractive but i don't think there has been any major change or renovation on the other floors where we have the rooms and suites. The security is kinda tight for in-house guests because the Lift won't work for you if you don't have the access key. The environment is neat and they have the largest event Hall in Lagos. They also have a cab park for those that didn't drive and can't access the tech-transport.
One of our favourite get aways

A beautiful place to be but quite pricey(it's Eko hotels of course, what do you expectüòâ)Quite comfortable and beautiful especially in the evening.I went there for the food (buffet) and it's totally worth every penny.
A regular here for many reasons.... Can't mention all... But if you've lodged here.... I'm sure you'll feel the same way

Superb in room service. Great place to be. The pool bar is awesome! Friendly service. You'll feel at home here. However, you may find the premises dirty over the weekend. In all, you'll enjoy your stay, you'll be comfortable!

Everyone has been to Eko Hotels & Suites! All the events happen here. From corporate events to concerts, etc. I saw Asa live in concert here in 2017. It was glorious.I had a bad experience here though at some office end of year party in December 2017. My new iPhone was stolen within 10 minutes of arriving at the party. I bought the phone like 2-3 weeks prior so it was really very painful. No jokes. We complained to the security guys but they weren‚Äôt of any use and they didn‚Äôt seem that interested.Also, that hideous carpet they have there needs to be changed like yesterday. It‚Äôs so ugly and old but for some reason, they haven‚Äôt deemed it fit to change it.

Fabulous hotel located in the heart of Victoria Island . Lush fittings and impressive furniture coupled with several restaurants and bars.Add to that the convention hall and adequate parking, it's no wonder why the hotel is a hit on all factors.The hotel boasts of Ample accommodation and is also home to a number of businesses.The convention center is the go to venue for concerts with ample seating and various exits. the structure of the  hall along with the multiple exits allow for efficient crowd/access controlplus it has a great venue for concerts.
The services are world class

Good ambience and view but you practically have to wait the whole day to get hot water running from the taps. Children will have a good time at the playground and don't forget to come with your swimming suits.

The building is spacious enough and those managing it are amiable but the place feels more like an art market then a gallery filled with critically selected art pieces. Still it provides a good perspective of what is going on generally in the Nigerian art world.

Cool though room service it's OK to drop everything paid for for that day even if some stuff haven't been used pls drop em u don't just assume and refuse to drop stuff cos some are still left eg soap tea etc that should different u from other hotels with smaller money that even give a mini sowing kit sanitary bag and lots more.
Wow, what a wonderful suites, beautiful and amazing environment

Nice staff, great location- The view is amazing! The Christmas period wasn‚Äôt kind to us, it was so rowdy because they had events almost every day, we had a stranger follow us all the way to our floor to beg for money, it was worrisome that He went past security.

The comfort, staff friendliness and ambience would make you want to stay longer than you planned, so lovely.Its got superb amenities, swimming pools, restaurants, and cozy rooms to make your stay pleasurable.The service here is also 24 hours so you're never stranded when you need help.And of course, expect to pay good money for the top notch service Eko Hotel offers.

Lovely Hotel. Large, clean well maintained rooms set in nice grounds. The staff are all helpful and friendly. Breakfast isn't the best, but for lunch and dinner there is a great choice of restaurants available.I stayed here in January 2019 for business, and would stay again if a future visit is required.
Excellent service and nice facilities. As a realtor, service is very key to me which is what they have. Kudos to Eko hotel and suites
If you go in for a private reason and you parked your car for more than 10minutes then you pay 500naira per hour but if it's for vendors or workers it's free
Explosive time I had, good first class services,super management.
It was okay, their food was good, but the furniture and bedsheets in the rooms are old. Also, there's poor communication between reception and the rooms, some complaints are left unattended.
Safe and secured place to be. Had a great lunch. Still as good as they were the last time O visited 5 years ago.üëçüëå
Great in Hospitality management
I enjoy Eko Hotel every time I visit. I love the pool side, especially in the evenings. Good halls for meetings, events, etc.Tasty Chinese foods at RED Restaurant.ü•Ç
Nice ambience. Rightly situated. Wonderful sound and light at the convention centre.

Decent hotel on Vic island with many outlets. IThink that‚Äôs what I liked the most about it.Hotel quality is not the best and feels very overused. It‚Äôs a compound with 3 or 4 buildings,so depending on your budget you can decide what to book. I would recommend staying at the Suites since it‚Äôs the newest wing.

Even with age Eko Hotel continues to maintain its standard as a five star hotel. Rooms are spacious and well kept. Parking has now been expanded to reduce the stress from over crowding caused by multiple event venues and halls that have become part of the hotel. Over all, Eko Hotel is still top notch.
Little contact in service delivery because of Covid.To place your order, you scan a QR barcode and order your preferred drinks/food.Excellent customer service.Rooms are nice.

Experienced with conventions and conferences, however, the facilities are below what's expected of world class event centre. The pool-side bar is quite nice...it was refreshing to sit in the open space and have a few drinks.
This place is very excellent I don't know if there's a better word to prescrip it
Has provision for every hospitality need.

Went for the Elite model look event last night, and thoroughly enjoyed the event.  Although we started late.  I must comment on the excellent security in Eko hotels and suites and event areas.  We felt very safe and the conveniences were clean and properly maintained.

In recent, experience in this hotel has been accompanied with:1. Lack of sufficient ironing machine to stretch your shirt. If you call for one, it takes forever to arrive. If it arrive, it does come without the board. Recently I had to travel with my own iron to save myself.2. In recent I had to call 3 times during my shower time to get solution as the water cuts off frequently.3. Placing order for anything from the room service is one of the most difficult thing do get into. You are better off using uberit or going out to eat.4. Seems there is so much patronage from government that the management is forgetting what it means to satisfy guest
This is one stop cluster of hotels in one, to say least it amazing with everything you would ask for and the Roof top bar, it breathtaking amazing views of the island, mind blowing

Good food, great service, good interior, good atmosphere and a lovely scenery too but my it will cost you a arm and a leg if you are not rich, so don't even think about it except you want to go on sight seeing and just enjoy good breeze on your brain so that it will be correct and think of ways to make more money. Okay maybe that is too much but hey hustle o, so that you can chill here on a regular.

This is an exclusive 5stars hotel in the city of Lagos for exclusive fun and exclusive privacy if you choose to have one. Eko Hotels  & Suites Signatures hqve a presidential lodge for high network individuals and high profile professionals when it comes to lodging in the city of Lagos.

Nice receptioningFully air conditioned, well chair accessible  tight security level, good parking spaces, highly hygienic food. Nice staffs, clean environments.. good beds and different food varieties
Beautiful groundsTop notch securityAmazing food

An awesome place to have an event or take a rest or sit out with friends and loved ones.The ambiance of Eko hotel is such that it gives you inner peace and joy.The parking space is large enough to contain a crowd of over 1,000 and more vehicles.Its system is automated and helps speed up work flowThe event hall is massive, no wonder alot of companies choose Eko hotels for events.The hotel has different hall size with different capacity so anyone who wants to have an event can select between their options.

Eko Hotel had always been a place of magnificent pleasure, both for foreigners and locals alike. From the amazing buffet breakfast to the beautiful evening pool side life, Eko Hotel is a place to relax and connect. There are lots of celebrities and businessmen and women who visit or lodge here. It is well positioned for private car owners and pedestrians in terms of access to the city. I have always enjoyed my stay here, these two nights are no exception. I just don't like the smoking floor. Perhaps they could inquire before putting people there. Besides that, the experience was great.

Eko Hotel never really disappoints. It is a historic hotel with unbeatable cuisine. It is yours for the asking and theirs for the providing. This is a classic choice for many A-list events. Spacious car parks that are always seeming inadequate depending on the traffic of events going on.
It has huge number of restaurants to choose from.Rooms are very spacious and welcoming.You get 5 star room services here.It is a huge pool.It is really nice. One of the best hotels in Lagos.

I loved it because of its elegance. I went there for the Amvca and boy did I love itüòç. Also the medical check was strict which is commendable. From point of entry, necessary checks were done. Eko Hotel is on of Lagos most classy place to go. You can be certain of their hygeine. And the foodü•Ç top notch

The hotel looks better than it is. Overpriced food and drinks. The breakfast was disgusting. Not worth 1 naira but it was 7500ngn. The staff is nice but I don't like the way they govern every amenity on the property.  Its not comfortable for a guest. Also if it's time to check out,  they will shut down your room water supply. It wasn't even time for us to check out and they shut it off. The staff made a mistake and my husband had to correct them. If you want a fun atmosphere this is not the place.  Everyone is too uptight
Great, and a lot of car parking space

Very big and beautiful with so many buildings and people... It has a big parking space and neat and standard restroom and is suitable for conferences.. The security guards are always willing to guide you.

They waste so much time on check out process. In 2019 you have to keep a piece of paper you are given on check in to use to check out. Else they scan your ID. In my case my international passport to get my refund. What if u don't have one on you? The world is computerised - checkout is easy everywhere else in the world except Lagos. Everything else was nice.

Eko Hotels and Towers is a mini paradise. The view inside is worthwhile. I loved the lighting under the wooden staircases outside.Oh, how I love their bar. The music in the bar was loud enough to shut out negative thoughts out of your mindüòÇBottom line is... when next you are in Lagos, visit Eko Hotel. It‚Äôs worth every good thing you‚Äôve heard about the placeüëå
Had Lunch (Buffet). The spread was wide, the staff were very warm and polite, the ambience was okay.

Had a live streaming engagement where we use their hall. I think the venue would be better with more signage with direction to restroom, halls etc. so you don't have to asked before you know where you are going

It's a very interesting eye-catching place to go to, it's buildings are beautiful, its environment is super clean, although its a bit expensive. Its a nice place with everything you can find, from foreign foods to local foods, pools to good and well furnished rooms

Eko Hotel & Suites made its statement of class long ago that I continue to be in awe of anytime I'm there.The expansion of the hotel and the new amenities seems to a regular thing. A hotel of class and comfort, I cannot see anything to fault from the entrance to car park to the friendly security guys to the beautiful sit out areas and to the amazing rooms whichever side of the hotel, Eko gardens or anyother you choose.This is a beautiful hotel for anything you want to do, you only want to think of using it when you can afford it. It is however not as expensive when compared to others in its class around the World. üòçüòçüòç
Eko Hotel definitely is a place you'll want to stay... To a large extent, it's value for money..As with every hospitality business, there's room for improvement

Totally overpriced.- Bad WiFi- No slippers- No shower gel (got it after three times asking the staff on the floor)- No proper light in bathroom- Wrecked front door to refrigerator- Brownouts throughout day and night- Conference facilities were solala, worst was that the large presentation screen didn't work and no backup was readily available until early afternoon...Despite the overall concept having all required facilities in the hotel complex (you don't need to leave the compound at all) this place is totally overpriced for the value offered.
Wow!  It's a beautiful place to visit.  Great food, lovely rooms and great environment.

Average. My room was barely ok, the bathroom definitely outdated and that was a bit creepy. The main areas are nice though so is the gym.So the average is... average.But the food is definitely priced too high and that is pure rubbery to pay 20‚Ç¨ for your breakfast in Nigeria. All restaurants if the Eko complex are way too expensive for what they offer.
Beautiful place, awesome staff except the secuy at the pedestrian gate. Awesome scenery, just perfect

I never stayed in this hotel but it does have a nice restaurant on the top floor that you can see the ocean and the surrounding City and they had live piano However the food was terrible, even gave me diarrhea and the price was the most expensive place I think I've ever eaten in my life. I ordered a drink and snack and that cost me 50 USD. I think the ambience is wonderful but it's not worth the terrible food, terrible price and sitting on the toilet the rest of the night. I don't think I will go back there.

Booked four nights here, fourth floor. Room, good size, bed good, needs new pillows. Bathroom average, smells highly of mildew. Probably at one point hotel was fantastic. However, inside rooms need to be updated and renovated. Outside of hotel same issues, renovate, paint pick up garbage from everwhere outside. Pool is good, swimmable for laps. Some lights need fixing. Lounges good. Food at Asian Fusion good so far

Ambience is üíØ... food & drinks is amazing although pricey. Has various event halls for hosting your events. The view from the rooms is amazing. Pool's also available. Room rates are quite pricey but worth it.

My gosh the entire property is so big and nice. The twin towers that's part of the Eko property is like second to none in Lagos, then there's an arts and craft centre, a resort, numerous swimming pools, ATM machines..., the entire property is just like a city of it's own.Then about the security, I'll say it's top notch! A visitor's Uber won't even be allowed to drive past the gate, as all visitors would have to sign in (and this isn't just a sign in of your name and arrival time, LOL). Signing in involves a robot/computer checking if you have a nose mask on, and if you do, if the mask is fit for a nose mask. An iris scan is also done, then a manual sign of name and arrival time, before visitors are issued a visitor's tag and allowed in (note that all these are possible when on arrival, it has been confirmed by the security department that a booking for your visit has been made by the person hosting/inviting you).If by chance you need something that's nowhere to be found within the property, by virtue of the location (Victoria Island), various lifestyle, social and commercial businesses are very close. On one of my visits, we planned to go to the cinema, apparently there was none within the Eko Hotels and Suites property, so we considered the Ebony cinema house about opposite the main gate if the twin towers.Another fascinating thing is the Heating Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems which is centrally managed. The underground parking if about 2 deck is also mind boggling!
Infact how to describe the experience I don't know all I have to say is seen is believing.

Honestly, I wasn't pleased. Take care of your rooms, the tiles, the bodywork of the rooms and the balcony door, the wardrobe door... Come on! At first I gave a 4 star but then I remembered everything and how displeased I was to pay so much and find the refrigerator empty and the scrutinizing stares of staffs... It's a no no. This hotel relies too much on its past glory. Y'all should buckle up please.

The go-to place in Lagos for events, concerts and some fine dining. This establishment is well appointed and caters to the middle to high class of society. My favourite restaurant is Crossroads, a Mexican place. It's lit on Wednesdays and the cocktails are amazing.
Intl. Conference Center,Hotels,Multiple Restaurant & Bar, Serves Local and Continental CuisineSit Out Area,Sky RestaurantGym, PoolOcean ViewLocated at the Center of Victoria Island Lagos.
Cool spot to chill, and their food is awesome....
Eko hotel is very good place for everything you need in life

Slowly getting back to what its used to be. I only thought that a hot towel or soap and water should be made available to clean /wash hands before meal at the buffet hall.  Hand sanitizers isn't good enough.

The hotel is a great place for the family and Business Visitors. It has the best of both worlds. Located in Victoria Island , the business hub in Lagos State. They have lots of activities especially during festive seasons. I lodged with my kids and we had loads of fun. There is a kids play garden, a tennis court , great fitness centre and of course a beautiful pool area . The meals are pretty pricy . Staff are courteous however I believe the manpower is low and if increased would meet immediate needs of visitors and avoid unnecessary delays. Aside that , it‚Äôs a great hotel

Its Eko Hotel, in a class of self for concerts and events. Significant improvement in service.Rack rates are moderately priced and alot of improvement in the ambience.Large pool, multiple halls for meetings, conferences and social events.Roof top sky lounge, tasty meals etc

It was a superb experience... The buffet service was world class with good Nigerian and continental variety of foods... There are also television screens in the buffet room that ensure that important matches (for football lovers) as well as other tv programs are shown in hd... Top notch location...

Great place for events and luxury lodging/hospitality. As with a place like this, it's a free for all environment though, so look out for your stuff especially in the open event spaces. Once I've lost my personal items at an event I attended.
It's a five star international hotel that holds deferent show during yelitude period,and also pay host to so many international guests all over the world.

Oh my!  I bet there's no better hotel in Lagos than this! The rooms are well furnished to world class, the pool is just amazing and there's a beautiful natural mini-park with swings just close to the pool. The most striking is that one can  have a good areal view of the ocean as well as the surrounding environment from the hotel.Furthermore, there's adequate parking space and good security so don't bother your head, you're safe here!
Nice place & staffs
It a beautiful place with standard practice visit procedures allied with maximum security

A luxurious hotel with an awesome get away experience. Consisting of a huge hall several events ranging from entertainment, corporate functions and others. A large leisure pool surrounded by sit in tables and chairs within a serene and cozy environment. It also has a buffet restaurant for all kinds of cuisines ranging from African to intercontinental dishes.

This place is a wow! We had our Annual CEOs Awards Night (UBA) at this place and the conference hall I think I saw at least 2000 seated and hundreds more working. There are massive parking lots for vehicles and the place secure, the food superb. But you will have to pay some good money for those. On the whole, the sea view and cool breeze coming from the from beautiful Atlantic night, the sound of the waves beating on the coastline, the swish and the swash, whatever you pay is good value for money.
The ambiance is serene

The prestigious Eko Hotel provides quality and comfort to all who visit it either for an event or to rent one of its room. The restroom is quite spacious and clean also. If you are privileged to visit, also visit Sky Restaurant, a restaurant in the penthouse of Eko Hotel. It has a magnific breathtaking view (if you are not afraid of heights, that is).

Just okay nothing extraordinary in my opinion. The Irish pub is nice and the setup / decor is pleasantPaid a second visit ! This time to the rooftop lounge .. the view from up there is awesome you should visit ......üòÅüòÅ
One of the best hotels in Lagos.Breakfast complete and yummy.Seamless service delivery.Staff are polite and kind always ready to assist.I highly recommend this place for everybody coming into Lagos.
It's incredible to dine out here by yourself or with family and friends. You will find a quiet place to read away from the buzz of events going on if you don't get distracted easily.
Maybeth events had a corporate decor for NIBSS at one of there halls
I had a good experience at Eko hotels although the mosquito bites outside the hotel were plenty. Nice place with nice service.
It is really quite most times and the service is great. Lovely views and fantastic scenery. The poolside bars are interesting and it's central enough on the island to get to anywhere.
It's a nice and cozy place place to be .. lovely experience. Though their food is a bit pricey. But it's really serene
Best hotel so far, rooms were beautifully decorated with killer views of Victoria island,buffet dinner and complimentary  breakfast was fire, wouod definitely recommend
Rooms were pretty run down, unfortunately...it was hoping it would have been better maintained over time.
Wonderful place to stay. Friendly staff. Wonderful cocktails up in the Sky restaurant.
It's such an amazing place to beThe food....The hospitality.....The rooms....Everything is just niceI don't wanna leaveüò©I would like to visit this place again
The place is great..pool side bar..cocktail menu üëåüèªüëåüèª

This is THE place for high octane events in Lagos.Bureaux de change have a corner on the premises. So, changing your foreign currencies is not a problem. I spotted a beach volleyball court during my last visit.The pool side is very cool! Oh, I almost forgot the food. Fantastic Nigerian cuisine absolutely. It's obvious that the chefs are seasoned.

üé∂ Olowo laye mo, baba temi di Owo re, gbogbo la-la Eda nitori Owo ni üé∂Translation: üé∂ The rich is who the world knows, Father Lord, my case is in your hands, all human struggle is cause of money üé∂A perfection of man handiwork, a great place for relaxation, party, event.. Serene environment, Fascinating settings, top notch artwork blend with nature..Visit for a job today but definitely coming back to dine with my family when I can afford it.

I don't know what I might say about Eko hotel that most people don't already know.But I like the meeting rooms and facilities the most. From small, to mid-sized rooms to large hall halls for all types of meeting and events.Why would you like to hold your meeting here instead of elsewhere. Well to start with, there is the ample parking spaces, security, uninterrupted power supply and helpful staff to help you out with your questions.And tell them Ejike the Google guide referred you.
Splendid place to lodged
Only went there for an event in there event hall...
It's a nice place to spend your free time

One of the nicest hotel I stayed in Lagos...Some pros and cons...Pros and cons together as below...1. The staff is good and helpful but to the great extent2. The duty manager is really good..Sorry I don't remember her name3. In case if you try to call duty manager from your room...Then forget....I have never seen them picking up the phone4. If you ask for any room service...Then just lie down and take a nap as no one would arrive before an hour or so...Or you need to followup with them on call to entertain you.... But this practice I have noticed in other hotels too in Lagos...5. The pool side is awesome and quite big6. The food is over price...Example the breakfast is 4 times the price I found in restaurants near by7. Please carry on your iron, in case if you iron your clothes by yourself as they will either won't give you iron or if they give then then will ak you to return it the same day or within few hours...As they have only iron and iron boards8. The ambience is cool9. The reveptionists (almost everyone) are pathetic...They will not listen you.  I will share one incidence... We use to get password for each day though I stayed there for 2 weeks... One day when I was requesting the reception guy for the password for longer duration.. a week or so, this guy's manager warned him not to entertain us...In front of us only...that is the worst experience I have seen in my life...And this doesn't only happened with me...But with my friends also...After this I never went to reception until it was my checkout day.10. The terrace was marvellous, you can orders for some drinks there11. The lift was awesome, it reminds me the life of Al burj Dubai...goes up and down in nano secondsThere are other things also about the hotel good and bad...But overall it was satisfactory...But not as good as it's name and price.
Serene environment, amazing view. Definitely a five star hotel. Eko hotel is definitely a place to go too

It's a beautiful place. However, I was embarrassed by a security man who approached me and my friends while we were making orders for drinks at the bar by the swimming pool to ask; "may I know your mission here?"We felt quite embarrassed and upon further inquiries he made us understand that the management of the hotel asked him and others to ask such question to any young lady that comes to that bar in the evening to sit and or make orders in order to checkmate the use of the bar by Prostitutes.My concern is that such question is mapped out for just ladies, meaning that young men are excluded because their are no male prostitute per se... I believe before such question is thrown at any customer,  they have to use common sense to analyze the person's personality and outfit.Anyways,  he later apologized.I advise the management amend such rules that discriminate and embarrass people because the hotel is too highly placed to have such preposterous rules.

Magnificent facility!, very organized parking arrangement, located at the heart of Lagos. I've gone there twice for the longrich bi-annual ceremony and it as worth the hype. Class was smelling everywhere.
The place is quite spacious. Didn't have any difficulty locating the venue. WiFi was a bit difficult to access though. No clear instructions on how to get it done. Other than that, I loved the place.
Helpful staff, good ambiance. Network connectivity can be a challenge. They have different conference rooms, with varying spaces, depending on the size of your event. Food was okay.

From the calmness of the security guards to the cheerfulness of the receptionist, Eko Hotels felt like home. That feeling was short-lived, though, because my bath water wasn't hot enough. I know there's a central dispenser but their idea of hot water is almost cold. In all, it's a beautiful place
Top class. All features for a luxury hotel, they've got it. Don't go there if cannot afford a luxurious lifestyle

This is the red Chinese resturant located in eko  hotel and suites.I just had dinner here, the first day of 2019 and It was lovely.I beleive the effectiveness of my taste buds were put to the test. The service was on time and the waiters were neat and well dressed. The environment was neat and view from the window is totally worth it.I don't why they didn't have the hot towels today but that wasn't a problem as you can always use the rest room to get your hands clean.Family friendly, child centric, warm place to hold dinners with loved ones. I will recommend this place to every one and least I forget go with your stomach empty and your pockets full of naira. üòÅ.
Dunno why it‚Äôs not a five star hotel. Besides it‚Äôs ambience and beckoning hospitality, you would bump into someone and voila! He doesn‚Äôt understand your language....lol
...the structure should win a 5 star offcourse, buffet is awesome...pool is great..laundry slow, room service slow, I enjoyed every bit though

I spent a week at Eko Suites, the room itself is decent enough (spacious and modern) whilst not in the class of what you'll get at Eko Signatures. The meals can be improved on, breakfast was always a let down, there's no dessert worth having with lunch or dinner. Service delivery is however very Good, nice and courteous staff members all over.
They need better chefs, the food at the breakfast buffet was always bleh

Eko hotel and suites is one amongst the post independent hospitality facilities in Lagos. One of the best in terms of patronage and services delivery. You will not like to go elsewhere once you discover the magic of youthfulness within the edifice.
The security guard at Irish pub is so rude he literally sent us out he looked down on my colleague and I

It's a nice place with so much laws now. A friend was asked to pay 2400 for sleeping the overnight, Guest must come down to take their visitors up. Your african dishes needs improvement. Others should pls add their complaints.

Fantastic location. Very central. I get company rates so it's a bit affordable. Their buffet get monotonous after a while. I wouldn't go there for a date. Rooms are ok. Some of them are really spacious. You can have a party there sef comfortably
Horrible service...for a highly priced so called 5 star, they can do better.  There 3 star hotels that  have better service and well trained staff.

Been there now 4 times... I don't know what I should tell you. Yes it is a good hotel. But a renovation would be suitable. Service declines every time I stay there. Pricing high. On european standarts its maximum a 4 star hotel.Black spots in the bath. And very noisy

the hotel is old and bad, the staff are unfriendly, they follow culture instead of being good, they are bloody arabs, the rooms are too white and the training was inapproprate, the trainees were not knoledgeable, and they were rude, the supervisors were poor and inappropriate

Here should be on your list for top places to vacay ,host an event or just pleasure.The services rendered are top notch.There's also a standard swimming pool, bush bar, restaurant, museum, security and emergency station.If you plan on visiting Nigeria,  you should stop by this wonder.It is a master piece situated in the heart of Lagos. Can be accessed by land or air.The environment is serene ,safe, eco friendly, the rooms are standard ( there's also Free WiFi ).The event halls varries and  are all state of the arts equipped for your weddings, meetings, social get together, parties, seminars, e.t.c.The friendly staffs are there to guide you and they got a warm reception for visitors.Feel free to walk to any of the staff to ask your questions.If you're a nature lover like me you'd find this place a home.As a photographer or business expert, you have all it takes at your finger tips.If you just want to explore you're more than welcome to stay.Don't forget , you can make your reservations online and that saves you all the stress .If you want a pick up from your arrival location, your welcome.Feel free to enjoy your stay.Eko ni baje...

When you think of that first choice hotel to accommodate your foreign friends and worry nothing about the service... The go-to hotel is Eko Hotel and Suites. With different categories to suit your needs, it offers you an amazing ambience to enjoy your business trip or leisure in Lagos.Also, if you're lucky to be around at a time when events are being hosted at the Convention Centre, it's an opportunity to be thrilled by top performers.It is not as expensive as you think though. Just give it a try and see!As always, thank me later.
Love the serene environment. So much to do and explore within the premises

I think its over rated..  the rate is okay and they should improve on their staffs. ON arrival the room I was checked into was not as I specified ( I really wanted a sea view) I had tp reject the soom for another room that I didn't still enjoy the sea view from (as the filling of the are for eko atlantic have moved the ocean afar off) I thought I booked a room with complinebtary breakfast as I saw the breakfast tag in the room. After calling the restaurant severally only for me to learn breakfast wasn't inclusive when I was on my food. Sincerely I don't recommend as I would have gotten a better place for a little lesser fee at Landmark Hotel.. I don't recommend!

Eko Hotels has always been one of the best place I would like to lodge when i come home but my experience left me regreting my choice of hotel.We came in for 2 nights, we were given a room that was leaking and a mould infested room meanwhile we were all sick especially my 9month old baby.I reported this issue early in the morning and at 12midnight of my second night to checkout was when they offered to change my room and going to see the second room also had mould in the bathroom. The room really stuffed as the air vent was also stuffed. This is really sad, I felt sad that I would this much to get such an experience.The location and accessibility to the island was great but my stay was miserable.

Eko hotels and suites is a lovely place to be in üòç although I haven't been in the rooms so if you are planning on lodging, take this review from someone who is acquainted with the environment and the dinner buffet.Lots of expatriates around so, it is either good enough or a great option for them.The ambience is cool üòé, not too quiet or too  noisy.You get to take nice pictures üñº ‚ò∫Ô∏è if you are the pictures type.The staff are courteous and have polite smiles for you.BUT!Parking üÖø though deserves work. If you are in a hurry to get out afterwards, lots of cars looking for a parking place disrupts you and it is just a single line and there are people being dropped off and all that ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.I also gat issues with the water üí¶ situation during the buffet. I get that juice ü•§, soda ü•§ and tea üçµ, you pay for but #1400 for a single bottle üçæ of water? Ouch! That hurts to go along with your#10,000 a head buffet. I think ü§î free water üí¶ can be given to guests along with their meals or else, charge smaller sums. But hey... If you can afford to go to Eko hotel üè© for buffet yeah?The female üö∫ toilet üöΩ was good. The staff is really taking good care of it. The men in my group though, weren't impressed with theirs. I cannot speak more to that cos I didn't use theirs.

There are various halls for events and they offer all in service with food and drinks. The downside is that left overs are left behind. They almost never make any effort to get you to take the food away.
Nice halls for events, good rooms and room service. Great view too. Swimming pool, bars and club. Chinese restaurant within (try the chicken cashew sauce)

I stayed in the Eko Suites and had a wonderful time. From the reception, it was all welcoming, I enjoyed the customer care given, it's truly a customer first culture that exists in Eko Suites. Well, I didn't quite smile at the cost of feeding but what else would one expect of a hotel of this standard? Large rooms with ample space and all the amenities one might wish for in a hotel accommodation. I surely would lodge here again soon.

Well I really don't know much about hotel ratings, but I feel Eko hotels & Suites should be 5 star in rating. The structures are world class standard, the environment is always neat, the food is excellent. The sky restaurant is a dream come true because you can almost see the whole of Victoria Island from where you sit.The lighting in the pool at night will almost want to make you swim. This is indeed a place to be.
Beautiful place to be. It has magnificent and outstanding buildings. It has provision for kiddies play ground so it's a perfect place to stay if you're going on vacation with your family..

This is a hotel of high standards, a great place to lodge, host events and relax with your eyes close. A place with great security network, good customer services and immediate response to calls irrespective of time. A trial will justify these. Have fun!

I like chilling at the Eko because it's centrally located on the Island. There's ample parking spaces. The staff are very courteous and well trained. The food is good, you get to choose which restaurant you want, as there different themed restaurant on the property.

Very big hotel in Victoria Island. Ticks all the boxes for big hotels. However I was a bit disappointed with the overall offering. The environment was busy and noisy. The room not as cool as I thought it would. There was no bath tub just a shower stall. The bathroom looked basic. Room was spacious and had a nice view from the balcony but everything else looked pretty basic.
The hotel is very ok, one of the best in Lagos. Though the general toilet smells terrible, also they have not been able to manage the street touts around their facilities.

It is a 5 star hotel. The compound is very large. They have underground event hall, conference hall, swimming pool, free WiFi, breakfast buffet, nonsmoking rooms, room service, suites, poolside bar, Chinese restaurant, conference centre, spacious rooms,And many moreA visit will convince you. The hotel is a master class. All kinds of event are hosted here.

Eko hotel & Suites....Spent some quality time at the pool area and I can say the quality of service is top notch and the grill offerings taste great.You may wanna to be careful with the ATMs inside the atm gallery as it appears they are fond of debiting your account and not providing the funds you want...Had a nasty experience with them and that's playing a huge role in my overall rating of the hotel..

Its the finest,most organized, neatest and coolest place to be in Lagos island. The experiences you will have here will leave sweet memories in you.They have several sizes of conference rooms for different occasions.Its a place you will get everything you need.
I went to crossroads on a Wednesday night briefly straight off my flight from Frankfurt. Awesome crowd, great music. Dress nice (I didn't and I felt out of place the entire time)

You think you deserve a lasting experience of hospitality mixed with lots of fun and first class guest treatment, service top notch and some of Nigeria local dishes best served. Eko Hotel & Suites is the place to be for you tourist coming into the Lagos and fun seekers. i can assure you that a lot of entertainment shows are hosted here. it is just the best place to be in Lagos.
Enjoy your holiday there

Wannabe 5 star hotel but only gets 3 stars here. Meals ordered are so bland, you'd do better to order food from outside the hotel. You don't get a fresh supply of lotion everyday. Only available on request. Clean and mostly secure. Popular for events.

The upscale spot for relaxation and temporal stay. Its seaside location gives it an added bonus of sea breeze and wave splashes. All these conjoined with the premium service of a 5-star hotel and concierge service and you have the makings of its reputation as an elite location for those who can afford it.
This is a place wlrds aren't enough to describe. It is a wonderful and well secured environment. A must be. I was at the power house for a maintenance routine service.

My colleague noticed the food at Kuramo Sport's Cafe had a taste but I'd already eaten all of my dinner.Needless to say, I had a terrible night with food poisoning and the hotel didn't have any medical facility or clinic even for staff...at that moment!
Top notch hotel..well maintained over the year,exclusive ambience...favourite spot is the pool bar & newly introduce VIP lounge with Cafe & freshly baked pastries.Pls visit guys

Great place that has everything.Equipped for:BusinessHuge fully equipped convention center.Globally Internet connected conference rooms.EntertainmentWonderful roomsGreat food in various restaurants open space restaurant.Gym, tennis court, swimming pool............All what you wish to have

My review really wouldn't do justice to this fine establishmentI spent 2weeks here and throughout my stay it was nothing short  of amazing.The breakfast menu was to kill for, i always looked forward to that. Then the wifi speed felt like there was a satellite in my room.My best moment was when i called the restaurant to Re-heat my dinner, only to have them bring me a microwave ü§£ü§£ü§£#like who does thatIt was so sad when i had to leave üò¢üò¢
Very nice excellent ambience for work or pleasure.
Nice and close to nature environment. The canopy walk is breathe taking and if u are not bold dont venture going on it. With a park where u can seat and eat ir food.
Superb lodging, exquisite space, lovely staff, cuisine is superb, enough parking spaces, tight security...kudos, keep it up

Cool Place, Suite is Beautifully Furnitured, Clean and perfect View from rooms on the 6th floor. Great Staff, atmosphere is sweet, you might want to have a love band on the weekends and or Club everyday.

Top class hotel in Victoria Island, just a few meters away from the popular Eko atlantic. And you can get a clear view of both the Eko Atlantic, Atlantic ocean and the whole of Victoria Island from most of its floors. With Beautiful restaurants and lounges and exotic cuisine, extremely wide parking space, hall and swimming pool, this hotel is by far one of the best in Lagos.
Excellent place to be, everything is inplace including art works, wheel chair entrance provided. Check it out.
Cool place.. Nice outside bar. The rooms are basically same of a 3 star Naija hotel sha.
Went for a business submit and their services were top-notch..
Lovely and secure place. Serene but occasionally busy
It's a fun and lively place to beI enjoyed every bit of my stay there and the room is super cool üòé
Great hotel services,  rooms and suites. They have great halls for small or big events or functions and meetings. The food is really good and their restaurants are nice and cozy.
Cool and nice place to stay
It was fun and exciting

Lodging in Eko is always a pleasant experience.Courteous staff, great ambience and restaurants.My favorite thing to do is having dinner by the pool side. The music by the band is sooting.There are frequent events for kids at a small fee.

So, I was at the hotel last weekend -- the Skyy lounge. At the first entrance, you'd be given a ticket if you're driving. They charge 200 naira per hour for parking. Make sure you don't lose the ticket. The place looks cool and the pool side was bubbling with so much activities. The pool is available for Lodgers, I think. From the pool area, the reception is a floor above. There's access to the elevator. If you're going to that lounge, you'd see the button, P (penthouse) to get to the last floor.The view there at the penthouse is amazing. You get get some really beautiful shots. The lounge is on the high side tho but then, everyone knows Eko hotel is top rated so that's not surprising. The experience  there was great. Every one is courteous and nice.

Wonderful and hospitable experience................as a matter of fact their services remind me of the awesome experiences at Business Inn, Ottawa Canada. There is value for money here.........Keep it up!!!

It's a great place situated in the heart of town.It has a beautiful convention centre for various events with many sections , many restaurants, bars and lounges.Crossroads is particularly nice, they have great burger and fries, awesome chicken wings, good music and ambience, great crowd, good staff. I also noticed that all their serving and take out materials are biodegradable or recyclable ‚ôª which made me really happy. They use paper straws and fancy paper bags.Their rooms are quite high end though. Mostly for high networth individuals. There are 3 different grades of the rooms. The most expensive is Eko Signature Hotel. The other two are Eko Gardens and the Main Eko Hotel...all in 3 seperate buildings.The rooms are beautiful. Their concierge is very polite, everything works properly, rooms are clean, you have over 50 DSTV channels, room service is good (PS: DON'T ORDER FOR ROOM SERVICE FRIED RICE. YOU'D BE BETTER OFF LICKING SAND).Sky lounge is beautiful and they have a wide array of drinks.There is a sort of emporium close to the pedestrian entrance for sales of artifacts, jewelry etc. It has a pool, a spa, a gym etc. The security guards are also very nice, polite and helpful.

Wonderful place to be. Offering an outdoor pool, barbecue and children's playground, Eko Hotels Limited is set in Lagos. The hotel has a terrace and spa centre, and guests can enjoy a meal at the restaurant. Free WiFi is available and free private parking is available on site.¬†Every room has a flat-screen TV. Enjoy a cup of tea while looking out at the sea or pool. Every room is fitted with a private bathroom. For your comfort, you will find slippers, free toiletries and a hair dryer.

Locating the "Asia Meeting Room" was a nightmare!Apparently, directions and signage aren't available for all the hotel's meeting rooms and you either know your way magically or prepare for an Ultimate Search

It was lovely. I first went to Eko Hotels September 2017 on a music producers serminar. The place is really heaven on earth. I almost caught a cold from the Air conditions. Felt like it was connected to the pacific ocean....üòáüòáüòá
When you're looking for a hotel that's luxurious, secured and has a beautiful environment in general, Eko hotel should be on your mind
Top class hotel in a calm and serene environment. Has a conference room as well for your meetings. The food is decent.

So many activities here so you'll probably never get bored staying here. This is arguably the busiest hotel in Lagos. So many restaurants and event spaces. Great view of the island from the room verandas. But if you're not staying in Eko Signature, your room is probably old school and basic. Rooms need renovation. It's bed and breakfast so you enjoy a buffet in the morning.
Top notch üëå, money well spent whenever you visit
It's one of the biggest hotels in Lagos located Adetokunbo Ademola Street, Victoria. Loved the ambience of the hall used to host quramo festival of words and the surroundings.

Great venue for weddings, concerts, shows, conferences, workshops, seminars and meetings. It has a nice ambience, exquisite interior decor and furnishing. And if I may add, great meals from Eko Signature!

Lives up to its name. My advise would be that you just need to know how to make use of all the facilities you have access to enjoy your stay to the fullest. Rooms are big enough and extra bed is given if you have kids.
It was thrilling. Had fun at the gamr x and watched Bnxn and Blaqbonez perform.
I've been at this Hotel numerous times, I've been at the sky bar twice, overall a great service, nice ambience and a good bird eye view from the sky bar.What do you expect of a "5*" hotel?

This is the one of the hotels with the largest Hall in Lagos Nigeria. It can accommodate thousands of people with comfort with good air-conditioning. Their room is nice and their chefs are very good. Most hospitality companies make use of this unique place. It's easily accessible.
Beautiful view of the sand filled ocean at the balcony, welcoming reception, clean sheets, also have some night life events one could relax n enjoy.

We were at the pool bar restaurant last night. Lagoon breeze. Totally unimpressed.  Bottle of beer is N1,800 but was not cold.  Had to use a ice bucket. Service was slow - took forever to get our drinks and food. They forgot my order. I ordered first and was the last to be served even though 4 other members of our group ordered the same. Roast chicken was ordinary at best. Wedges were ok. Chilli sauce was only saving grace. Ambience is nice but mosquitoes everywhere. This is supposed to be a 5* hotel and for the amount charged I expected so much more. I wont be going back anytime soon as there are much better options with greater value for money out there.

This is a 5-star hotel situated in high brow neighbourhood of Victoria island in Lagos. It comprises of 4 buildings with various restaurants, a big event hall that can sit up to 5,000 people. It has a swimming pool, beauty spa, laundry, bars, gym & sports centre and an ample space for carpark.
Renovated classic. Love the Irish pub ...and the Sky Lounge is always good for the view, if not the poor service and way below par food.

Good hotel but please check sea view room before booking because few rooms block Ur vision .So called  Indian food serve in breakfast.All managers are very good and cooperative .Always book online because they give u better price . They have 4 buildings so always careful while booking ( eco garden , signature ) .Never exchange your money at hotel reception because they also give less . In hotel compound near exit gate you will get better exchange prices .
The rooms are mediocre in my opinion. Nothing special. Their event/conference centres are fantastic though. A hub for shows, concerts, meetings etc. Ample parking space.

Love the ambience at pool side but wasn't impressed with the food and Chapman. Even my kids stated that the chicken wasn't that great. But overall I'll still come back because I love the ambience.....
Awesome venue and ambience

So I visited with my friend during an audition for models. MehnnnI‚Äôm on YOUTUBE üíïüíï check my out: Chidera StephenThe place is really big and cozy. The security check point was apt and they have side attractions. One that I was proud of was the bead shop. I got two, they also have a store for art and sculptures. They washroom was clean and during the audition they tried to minimize noise as much as possible. You can‚Äôt get snacks inside( what I noticed if you are not lodged and want to save cost) but you can go outside and get them. I‚Äôm a youtuber lol.I got some fine neck pieceIt‚Äôs Afrocentric and I‚Äôm natural so YeahhI was definitely stunned MehnnBelow are some pictures I took around the spotHave a blast

Well spacious event center aside the hotel section of the location, located at the serene location with the water ways view a cool ocean and fresh air and breeze, giving the calmness of mind and hustle and bustle of business atmosphere of Lagos, sorrounded by big firm and organisations like the GTB bank across the main entrance, and beside it is a reputable oil and gas firm office.

It's an awesome place to be. Very spacious and it's a wonderful place to network easily.. The atmosphere is very serene with lots of vegetation. The ocean view is captivating.. Their meals OMGüëèüëè......
It's always a breath of fresh air everytime I visit, my room view is just breath taking, amazing time I love it
Buffet was terrible and really crowded! Why take payment at 3;30PM when you know Buffet ends at 4pm? Who does that?

Eko Hotel is meant for the traveller who seeks a good balance between business and relaxation. Eco-friendly business and pleasure facilities combine with a good location to welcome customers. Apart from the main restaurant that offers buffet services for African and continental dishes, there are others tailored to specialized cuisine. Rooms are well cared for, and offer some of the best in the industry. Understandably, the hotel attracts crowds, so expect some delays in traffic driving in and out, and at peak times, during check-in and check-out.
Interesting place to lodge.It has a pool, bar, restaurant, and a lot of things.The rooms are home away from home. Nice selection of meals on the buffet menu.

Still one of the most reliable hospitality centres with a huge capacity event centre. Clean rooms and good service. Various restaurants on site: Red for Chinese,  Crossroads for TexMex, 1415 Signature for Italian, MyThai for Thai. Recommended for weekend getaways and family time out. Beware of huge crowds when there are social events
Nice hotel, the service wasn't bad I'd say 8 out of 10
The ambiance and serene is exquisite.Security wise and crowd control,  the management should pay more attention on the main building.

Eko Garden only:  West facing rooms are 30 meters from unfathomable air pollution.  During the holidays in particular dust blowing in from the Sahara traps traffic emissions.    The bathroom blower had no off setting. Constantly it sucks the air out of the room and sucks in seemingly pure traffic smoke.   Our otherwise GORGEOUS 4-star room had a large gap under the door for the smoke to come through, no weather-stripping at all.   The facility as a whole is very impressive.  For our last night we moved into Eko Signature.  It was outstanding and a great price.

I haven't lodged at Eko hotels and suites yet but have attended a couple of conferences at the convention center and recently took my son's for the their weekly Sunday funday for kids.The hotel is contemporary and their amenities are up to date. The ambience is calm and relaxing, both local and continental dishes are served at their restaurants.
I gave my hubby a anniversary surprise here and my requests for room decor was met to point and beyond! I'm was super impressed. Lovely ambience too.
Somehow managing to keep up and maintain despite the very harsh economic climate, of unprecedented difficulty caused by clumsy,bumbling, hamfisted policies- so it would appear, at least .
Amazing food. Try to get there early for brunches so as not to miss all the good good. Great customer experience
top notch
Great place with different restaurants and lovely ocean view. I love their food ‚ò∫. Safety and health  is 10/10 especially at this period of covidüëå

One of the best venues to hold a large event in Lagos, simply because of the sheer size of the hotel and the number of meeting rooms they have. Even though we had a huge problem with construction noise during our event, a partial refund was offered to compensate. The catering is pretty pricey for the value you get. I recommend for large events only.

Eko Hotel is one of the most relaxing hotels i have found myself in. From exquisite rooms to relaxing meeting halls, it is full of comfort. The natural environment makes it more beautiful and welcoming especially in a city like Lagos. There are swimming pools and an artificial water reserve, gym facilities etc. I felt so calm being here and just didn't want to leave. The food was nice except for the samosa which was too soggy. Security is very good. However the ambience... That ambience is worth everything.
Awesome. Good for vacation
All time favourite spot for Sunday brunch and week day networking. Service is always excellent...try out the Irish bar and thank me later!

Eko Hotels is a place anyone would love. The thought process that brought about this hotel is worthy of commendation. Truly international and local at the same time, vast landmass. Eko Hotels, gardens, suites, signature is just for anyone and everyone who loves quality. The customer service, restaurant, pool side, gymnasium....in fact, I love Eko Hotels..Great for business meetings, events, get away, anything and everything you want in a hotel is Eko!

I was at the restaurant was attended by courteous staff and nice environment. However, I was disappointed about the food to say the least. Management needs to work seriously on the variety and taste of the food.
Eko Hotels & suites is a comfortable and very nice place to be if you have not been there before you are missing.
Cool get away place; too secure and meets the standard, the price however says big men only. The conference hall is amazing, they have different sizes available to suit your occasion.

Pleasant place, you value it once you know the standards in Lagos, possibly the first glimpse will be a little disappointing, if you need to book there you need to request for proper fumigation as I‚Äôve spotted a cockroach on my bed and then I requested to change my room to the Eko Signature which is more expensive but up to any world standards. The hotel got plenty of events happening which will keep you busy. Beware of business ladies as they can be persistent and sometimes annoying.
Attending an event(concert) by a very popular artiste? Prepare for the frustration. Otherwise, you‚Äôre good.Keep your phone tight and your bag tighter.

The best part of my stay at Eko hotel was how professional and polite the staff are. I‚Äôll give them full points for that and the power of their A/C units. Breakfast at the main hotel felt a bit chaotic and the staff there seemed overwhelmed. Breakfast at the 88 however, was a lot calmer and chilled out even though they didn‚Äôt have such a variety of options .The room i got was at Eko garden and because it was a long and busy weekend in Lagos almost every noise filters into the rooms. The floors are tiled, therefore, any moving around of furniture or heavy objects can be heard in the next room beside or beneath yours.The gym is a fitness junkie paradise and i love how they included some manual fitness machines outside near the play ground.Eko signature is my favorite ambience wise of the four hotels available on the grounds.Business or pleasure you will not be disappointed.
Your guards should be trained to treat journalists with respect. Turning people away for no reason is bad customer practice.
I had one of the best experienceTheir staff is so nice ‚ù§Ô∏è
One of the exotic hotels in Lagos, Nigeria... A serene environment for all kinds of events.
Ambience üíØUncut learning this year was so beautiful.

Is one of the  3 star hotel in Nigeria and  one of the biggest hotel with quality facilities, with almost 2000, rooms, including large space for their car park, with full security, including big swimming pool, non stop power supply is a place people like to be.

Eko Hotels & Suites is the most preferred hotel in West Africa and it's all about the right mix! Located in the heart of Victoria Island Lagos Nigeria and shielded from the hustle and bustle of the Lagos metropolis, they offer their corporate clients and walk in guests a perfect blend of relaxation, activities, and African tradition delicately infused to meet the highest international standards.Overlooking the Eko Atlantic City and Ocean, it is just a 10-minute drive to the City Centre and only 45minutes away from the Airport. Eko hotels are designed for your comfort and convenience. Your security is their primary concern and you'll find their customer care second to none.

It's ok. But not outstanding. Thr premises feels dated compared to the likes of Radisson Blu Hotel, Oriental and four points by Sheraton which are within 2 Miles radius from it. Parking is adequate but exiting the premises for a first time visitor is a herculean task as the signages are not adequate
What more can be said. Top quality standards delivered over a long period of time.
Best book of the year so far.... Finding A Good HusbandVery inspiring, down-to-earth and practicalHighly recommended
Me and my family spent Christmas at the luxurious Eko Signature hotels. The kids had the time of their lives as we all enjoyed the tropical Christmas festival hosted by the hotel. Awesome time!!
The facilities are world-class! The conference hall is easily one of the best I've ever seen in my life. It's worth it if you have the money

Everytime I'm here, there's this disgusting attitude towards single ladies which is always different when I'm with a male friend. Take tonight for example, So I have been seated for the past 20mins and all the waiters have studiously ignored me and are yet to take my order because I'm a lady sitting alone without a man!!!

My visit to Eko Hotel and Suites was for the Investiture of the New President of Lagos Chamber which was held in one of the Conference Halls of the Hotel.The food served by the Hotel was as would be expected from a 5 Star Hotel that it is. The Hall was well decorated and the other facilities such as the rest rooms were very neat though not near the Halls that were used.
Hotel with luxury. Awesome experience ü•∞

A hotel that has been able to maintain it standards over the years and compete fearlessly with new entrants in the hospitality business, some of which are established international hotel chains.This is my first visit to Eko Hotel after about five years and I have been pleasantly surprised by the number of improvements. There are now dedicated gates for entry and exit, a lot of security improvements and a massive parking lot.The rooms could do with a little makeover but overall its a nice place to stay

Great place with all great facilities... I assure you that the experience when u visit here would be definitely awesome, I personally recommend this place for all of you.Go there and feel the 5 star experience.üëç
A good place to host conferences, exhibitions and the likes. Parking can be a bit of a hurdle especially when an event is ongoing. We had a delay leaving the venue due to the traffic.

I love the beautiful ocean view; one of the best views in Lagos. My favorite spot is the poolside especially on a happy hour Friday. You'll get all manner of local and continental artisanal dishes here.

A Convention centre that can sit close to 5000 people with matching parking space, Eko Hotels & Suites comes highly recommended for all types of events.Whether it's a wedding or conference, you'll find a suitable space for your event.And there's lodging too.However, if you're just driving through, note that parking comes at a fee that charged hourly.
A great place for relaxation, site seeing, a kind of museum, lodging. Also cool for Seminars, Conferences, Exhibitions, Talent shows and so on
Eko Hotel is a very nice place to be dow try it today and have a beautiful experiences thank you.
The pool is really amazing but FOOD - below average. Needs urgent improvement.Playground for kids is mostly reason l go there.

Eko Hotel, with the ancient feel around the serene environment, is a very great hotel to lodge at, on Victoria Island. I have stayed at this massive hotel for two times. the Garden is great but a bit of noise due to the ongoing construction works. The main building is peaceful and saner.Except that food is expensive and not impressive. Drinks too, as  a bottle of Maltina was sold for about #1400.
Top notch Rooms and location but service could be improved on
Good Highend hotel,but staff needs to be more professional only 2 people were there and one was on phone taking bookings and we kept standing for 10 min to finish the call to get our room,.
nice place, beautiful evironment... The rooms are very okay. top notch. nice hospitalityDeserves a 5 star rating
Always a lively and good casual or formal business meeting spot. Good range of choices for restaurants and bars in the hotel complex. Excellent security and always good place for kids on day out!
It is obviously on the high side of luxury but .. trust me the experience is worth every penny.From the entrance to the last point in the hotel ..Eko Hotel has got it's luxury on point

The food is great. Staff interest is quite changing. Some if them are so friendly, some of them not. Rooms are ok, not high expectations but they are ok. The poolside in the main building is a peaceful place.

I have visited the restaurant of the hotel and the garden near the swimming pool. The restaurant's buffet is very rich and the food is very good. The price per person on Sundays is 13000 naira inclusive of 3 mineral drinks. The garden is relaxing and you can enjoy your drinks sitting near the swimming pool and high palm trees.

This is really a place you should go. Its expensive but worth it.I would not advise you to visit if you are not adequately fundedIts a place for the really elegant and wealthy.It has an ample parking spaceThe service is top notch as the waiters are well mannered and respectfulEko hotel is a beacon
One of d best hotel in Africa

Fantastic place with various choice of hotels and restaurants according to your taste bud. Also, the halls are always booked with one event or the other happening there. In the case of big events, car parking is almost always an issue.
Great for event, above average acoustic performance. Sitting areas are comfortable and visibility from gallery in main hall is perfect.
Very good

They don't even deserve one star!!! Horrible service, cockroach infested, brown water that stenched of chlorine, same type of meal almost everyday,...this is one visit I looked forward to but regret deeply!!! One of their staff at the lagoon breeze called Israel,was VERY VERY rude and after escalating the matter,he never greeted me again!!! They all seem to be running after the white guests and sizing people up before serving you with their horrible attitude!!! Very overrated place!!!
Feels like outside the country,very organised setting with well trained security personnel

this is a huge and well built hotel with a 6000 capacity convention center that has an ambience you would love for days. sound system is top notch. organised from security at the gate to inside the hotel. for international conferences and symposium this is your go to place.
One of the best hotels in Lagos and Nigeria. Very good access control. Ample and well laid out car parks. Good food in multi-cultural buffet arrangement.
Love and care among customers and staffs. Staffs are also doing their jobs with willingness. More also the environment is clean, neat and facilities are of standard...

The old wing and places are getting cranky and only living on past glory. The central air conditioning system is gradually getting worse by the day. Good food though. Good practice on lift to prevent unauthorized access to the floors.
Incredible landmass inside the city centre. Lack of personal touch still lacking. But overall improvement noticeable compared with last visit two years ago.

World class Hotel and suites with great up-to-date equipped event centers for your convenient and meetings. On a class of its own in Victirial Island Lagos. Get ready for the Prices of things and  the rooms of your choice and level. Good security and great environment. Its a landmark.
I haven't lodged here yet but I have attended a number of events at the convention center and other halls in the facility. Good sound ambience. The people are helpful and professional.
The hotel still live up to it‚Äôs standard but can still do better going with the hype.
Excellent dining experience at the lunch buffet today. Customer service is above par. Food was simply delicious. Worth the money.

Clean rooms. Facilities on site incl. A swimming pool, tennis and basketball court, a gym and a kiddie play area. They also have a gym and hair dressers salon.A couple or restaurants on site make it great for keeping entertained while on site.
Good hotel. If you used to travelling and quality lodging. This is far from a 5 star.3 star is more like it. Great event centre service, poolside relazation ok. Large parking, good security.
Went for a dinner partyAmbiance was really niceFood was very average..not impressed at all
Eko Hotel is worth the hype..Calm Environment and Friendly Attendants

I guess one can say it's more than just a hotel. I love visiting in the evenings and hanging out by the poolside. There are a couple of bars and restaurants there and the with the lights, the ambience is relaxing and with ocean breeze, it's just amazing. And pricey too.The rooms are beautiful, the service is amazing. They also have multipurpose event halls.You might have to pay for parking if you stay longer than 10mins though. Unless you re lodging.Overall its it's quite exquisite. C'est tres bien üëåüèø

This hotel is one the most impressive hotels have lodged in, while staying in Lagos. I am totally in love with their service (especially the food üòã ), üòç and would strongly recommend to anyone hoping to enjoy a classy stay in Lagos.

The hotel is showing serious signs of aging. Sad to say that its hey days are way gone past. I had a buffet there. The price is competitive when compared with similar hotels in VI. The pool area and the general ambience leaves more to be desired. That's why I think they belong in the 4 star category until they make drastic improvements.

If you ever need a place to relax and enjoy the view of the ocean, then Eko Hotels and Suites is the place to be. From the clear pools, to the bar, to the restaurant which runs a buffet üòÅ, and the different rooms which hold elegance and hospitality no matter the size or price.The only downside is the traffic in its environ; it is a rude awakening to the tranquility you are going to leave behindüò∞

Event went well due to the excellence of the hotel, only drawback being a better plan to exit after the event is over.The hotel has employed a better cook who has definitely improved the taste of the food

The view of the restaurant deserves 5 stars. its a beautiful place for a romantic dinner in the evening/night. Pricing I must say ,its not really pocket friendly. Chinese must always be reasonably priced

This is one place that knows the value of a cold bottle of beer. Many spots for eating and drinking. Ate at the crossroads bar, which used to be the casino entry, fantastic arena, I hear that's whereby to be on a Wednesday evening
Very iconic place in the city of Lagos. Ever so busy. Looks like the land area has reached its carrying capacity limit for buildings now. This makes the hotel look very choked up.

Very ambient and lovely rooms. Quite a no of restaurants both within and around the hotel hence food isnt a problem at all. However, the wifi service isnt straightforward in terms of connecting and usage of same. Also even though the TV is very modern and new, all the channels being broadcasted arent clear at all-one would have thought aerial cables are still been used

All the concerts in Lagos happen here. If your favorite artist hasn't performed here, he's not big enough üòÇ. Great place to lodge as a tourist, a lot of events go on here and their buffets are good too

One of my best places so far! I have stayed nights in several hotels and almost sure I must find a mosquito. I never found any in this hotel. Staff were cool....food was good....internet was good. Overall a very good place to visit.
I simply loved being here. The ambience is just right. You have to try their pool as well..I know I enjoyed swimming in it. Extremely pleasant and helpful staff
One of the best hotels in Victoria Island. Great club- Crossroads. Great food at the Grill and Sky lounge. Buzzing with life and multiple events virtually everyday
Nice place with different personalities coming in and out. The bar and cafe is good, environmental is airy and nice to relax, if you love live music then I recommend you visit on Wednesday..

Oh well, I'm usually here for meetings and other engagements, but i daresay the layout is magnificent and services are well managed all around the clock. I was in a room once in the Signature and i daresay its the largest hotel room ive ever been in, i felt like i wqs in someone's living room üòÖ

Located strategically in Victoria Island, with proximity to Kuramo waters and Eko Atlantic, Eko hotels and Suited offers warm reception and hospitality to everyone.It's such a monument that has lived over the years and still offers great services.Its very large environment has a lot of gardens and drives.It offers concierge services and luxury cab services.A beautiful and symbolic swimming pool is located close to the gardens and lawns and is a great place to sit out and bask under the sun.Want to try something new? You can book a room in the Signature towers.With friendly staff, you are most definitely going to get all the assistance you will ever need.

Eko Signature to be specific is a nice and classy part of Eko Hotel which is centrally located in Victoria Island. Their premium suites are good for families and even better for business. Very professional front desk staff. Love it and no regrets so far.
It was very nice. The hotel is very clean

Eko Hotel and Suites is awesome and a remarkable place to be, visit and stay. It is built on the exclusive Victoria Island and blends natural beauty and architectural aesthetics in the most astonishing manner. It's spread over three buildings with spectacular views of the Atlantic Ocean and the Kuramo Lagoon.Eko Hotel offers a wide range of world-class hotel services, like State-of-the-art meeting rooms, Hall with very capacity, outdoor pool with surrounding sit out, fitness centre complimented by a well-equipped gym, event halls, an array of restaurants that offer mouth-watering dishes from different parts of the world, bar/lounge fitted with choice drinks.
Was here for a training and their services were poor. Snacks like sweets and bitter kola etc. We're unavailable even after being paid for earlier. They really should do better.
Eko hotels is a very amazing place in Lagos.  They boast of very good quality service, apartment and food!
Comfortable  and lovely dining experience. If you are also looking  for somewhere you can make picturable memories I would definitely recommend.

Better than my expectations. Air condition is good(you really need because humidity is very high in Lagos) everyday they put water into room ( generally you have to buy in the second day). Down duvets are made in Turkey and you really need since humidity is higher and you need a coldbweather in the room to sleep well. Breakfast was good. Breads were different than usual.

Signature Suites looks very spacious and fresh. A huge difference from the regular rooms. Have not experienced the service enough on this wing of the hotel to say how good but the room and aesthetics are really nice.

Waoo. Long time ago i visited Eko Hotels & Suites. The place has changed beautifully well. New entrance one way in. The former entrance now one way out. Breakfast was fantastic and full varieties to choose from. Real 5 star hotel.Staff courteous and smartly dressed.

Cool, classy and a great hotel to be. Value for your money, also a great place to have your parties, seminars and public lectures. Great meals, well trained and polite employees as well. Most importantly a wonderful GM.

From the architectural design, to the concierge service and outdoors. This is a place to inspire your family and team with a getaway right inside the hustle and bustle of Lagos.Facilities:Car parks : wheelchair accessibleEntrance: Wheelchair accessibleRestaurantsOutdoor bars and barbecueConferencingAccommodationGymnasiumSpa.
SERVICE IS BAD, ROOM DOESN'T DESERVE 2 STARS, BREAKFAST VERY BAD AND MOST FORR NOT FRESH AND NO OPTIONS, IN GENERAL AM NOT RECOMMENDING THIS PLACE

Eko Hotels is one of the best hotels in Nigeria. Safe, secure, located in a good area and with lots of facilities. The management however needs to up their game. There are lots of spaces for improvement. For instance, the shower in my room did not work, making me miss an appointment because I least expected a non-working shower to be in my room. I had to call for a bucket which ate way into my time. The room service changed the broken shower before I returned from my meeting
We come here to the pool side restaurant. Food is good and the ambience is great. Truly enjoyable place. Staff is very nice, our waitress Ronke is very attentive.

One of the best hotel brand in Lagos, it's overly expensive with a lot of security flaws. It's actually the best place to have indoor concert in Lagos, especially for a large crowd.I personally prefer the place for events than accommodation.
Excellent service, ambiance, and worth every moment of it.

Eko Hotel and Suites remains the first choice for a lot of event hosts. The halls come pricey because they have the space, the right location to connect different parts of Lagos and the amenities.It is elegant and secure. I attended a #shugaband concert there yesterday and my expectation was met but, I suggest they work on their basement elevator and tidy some loose ends like the time to dispose waste.It is a 5 star hotel. Stayed in their rooms twice, it's cozy and luxury. Overlooks some really beautiful sceneries....... Sea and greenery views. You should consider a visit.

A beautiful and arguably the biggest hotels in Lagos. Here most big social events in Lagos are hosted and most visitors and foreigners in the country find a home away from home here. They have good standards and is always busy with activities
Nice and spacious rooms. The Eko garden exterior looks outdated but the interior is fine. The hallway has some type of smell, but overall, I'd  stay here again. Maybe the signature building
Always a nice experience
awesome. they are also able to handle large crowds rather well

I had a great time today at Eko hotel. I attended a medical symposium that took place at the Diamond Suite. It's a really affordable location, great ambience. The meeting room can house about 25 people. I enquired and it cost only 180k to rent the space.
Sunday buffet lunch in Eko Hotel is epic! The live band is fantastic.  I absolutely loved every minute of my time there

Sunday afternoon is good if you are looking for kids funtime. They charge N4000/kids with free rides, Jumping castle, Toy train, Lunch, Snax and swimming pool access. Worth spending time on Sunday with kids.

It is an exclusive and fairly luxurious hotel with nice view of the sea. It has a beautiful garden /park which my son loved so much. Eating in the restaurant was great is there are vast variety of foods both local and continental dishes. Room service was great as well.  Cleaners did great job everyday withe the cleaning. Bathroom towels were changed daily. Ah the swimming pool was exclusive as well.  The ACs were contant which kept the room really chilled. Internet service was excellent too. Lundary did a very good job as well. My family had a 'wow' stay
Nice food.

I was there for a corporate meeting at the executive boardroom. There were other corporate events going on too at the same time. Auditions for a beauty contest were also ongoing with lots of contestants both male and female in the same Eko Signature suites.
